translated: For instance, in deep sleep and in one who is on the point of death, when the function of the prāṇa, which consists in moving to and fro, is present, the operations of the mind are seen to cease.

original: na ca manasaḥ svarūpa apyayaḥ prāṇe saṃbhavati /
analyzed: na ca manasaḥ svarūpa apyayaḥ prāṇe saṃbhavati
translated: And the merging of the nature of the mind into the prāṇa is not possible.

original: atat prakṛtitvāt /
analyzed: a tad prakṛti tvāt
translated: Because it is not of the same nature as that.

original: nanu darśitaṃ manasaḥ prāṇaprakṛtitvam /
analyzed: nanu darśitam manasaḥ prāṇa prakṛti tvam
translated: But has not the fact of the mind being of the same nature as the prāṇa been shown?

original: na etat sāram /
analyzed: na etat sāram
translated: This is not essential.

original: na hi īdṛśena prāṇāḍikena tat prakṛtitvena manaḥ prāṇe saṃpattum arhati /
analyzed: na hi īdṛśena prāṇāḍikena tat prakṛti tvena manaḥ prāṇe saṃpattum arhati
translated: For the mind cannot merge into the prāṇa by such a remote relation of being of the same nature as that.

original: evam api hi anne manaḥ saṃpadyeta apsu ca annam apsu eva ca prāṇaḥ /
analyzed: evam api hi anne manaḥ saṃpadyeta apsu ca annam apsu eva ca prāṇaḥ
translated: Even so, the mind would merge into food, and food into water, and the prāṇa into water.

original: na hi etasmin api pakṣe prāṇabhāvapariṇatābhyaḥ adbhyo mano jāyata iti kiñcana pramāṇam asti tasmāt na manasaḥ prāṇe svarūpa apyayaḥ /
analyzed: na hi etasmin api pakṣe prāṇa bhāva pariṇatābhyaḥ adbhyaḥ manaḥ jāyate iti kiñcana pramāṇam asti tasmāt na manasaḥ prāṇe svarūpa apyayaḥ
translated: For there is no proof whatever that in this case also the mind is produced from water which has been transformed into the nature of the prāṇa. Therefore the nature of the mind does not merge into the prāṇa.

original: vṛtti apyaye api tu śabdaḥ avakalpate vṛttivattimatoḥ abheda upacārāt iti darśitam // //
analyzed: vṛtti apyaye api tu śabdaḥ avakalpate vṛtti vattimatoḥ abheda upacārāt iti darśitam  /
translated: But the word (apaiti, merges) is appropriate in the sense of the merging of the operations, because there is a figurative identification of the possessor of the operations with the operations. This has been shown.

original: adhyakṣa adhikaraṇam / sū /
analyzed: adhyakṣa adhikaraṇam sū
translated: The section on perception. Sūtra.

original: so 'dhyakṣe tadupagamādibhyaḥ / / / /
analyzed: saḥ dhī akṣe tad upagama ādibhyaḥ
translated: That (mind) merges into the overlord, because of its approach to that and other reasons.

original: sthitam etat yasya yato na utpattiḥ tasya tasmin vṛttipralayo na svarūpapralaya iti /
analyzed: sthitam etat yasya yatas na utpattiḥ tasya tasmin vṛtti pralayaḥ na svarūpa pralayaḥ iti
translated: It is established that for that which does not originate from something, there is dissolution of its function in that, not dissolution of its own nature.

original: idam idānīṃ prāṇaḥ tejasi iti atra cintyate
analyzed: idam idānīm prāṇaḥ tejasi iti atra cintyate
translated: Now this is to be considered here: The prāṇa in fire.

original: kiṃ yathāśruti prāṇasya tejasi eva vṛtti upasaṃhāraḥ kiṃvā deha indriyapañjara adhyakṣe jīva iti /
analyzed: kim yathāśruti prāṇasya tejasi eva vṛtti upasaṃhāraḥ kiṃvā deha indriyapañjara adhyakṣe jīva iti
translated: Is the prāṇa, as stated in the śruti, dissolved only in fire, or in the individual soul that is the overseer of the body and sense organs?

original: tatra śruteḥ anatiśaṅkyatvāt prāṇasya tejasi eva saṃpattiḥ syāt aśrutakalpanāyā anyāyyatvāt iti /
analyzed: tatra śruteḥ anatiśaṅkya tvāt prāṇasya tejasi eva saṃpattiḥ syāt aśrutakalpanāyāḥ anyāyya tvāt iti
translated: There, since the śruti cannot be doubted, the prāṇa would be merged only in fire, because it is not proper to assume what is not stated.

original: evaṃ prāpte pratipadyate saḥ adhyakṣa iti /
analyzed: evam prāpte pratipadyate saḥ adhyakṣaḥ iti
translated: Having reached this conclusion, he replies: It rests in the overseer.

original: sa prakṛtaḥ prāṇaḥ adhyakṣe avidyākarmapūrvaprajña upādhike vijñāna ātmani avatiṣṭhate /
analyzed: sa prakṛtaḥ prāṇaḥ adhyakṣe avidyā karma pūrvaprajña upādhike vijñāna ātmani avatiṣṭhate
translated: That prāṇa, the subject, rests in the individual soul, which is the basis of the knowledge that preceded through ignorance and action.

original: tat pradhānā prāṇavṛttiḥ bhavati iti arthaḥ /
analyzed: tad pradhānā prāṇavṛttiḥ bhavati iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the function of the prāṇa has that as its primary basis.

original: kutaḥ tat upagamādibhyaḥ /
analyzed: kutas tat upagama ādibhyaḥ
translated: From what? From its going there and so on.

original: evam eva imam ātmānam antakāle sarve prāṇā abhisāmayanti yatra etat ūrdhva ucchvāsī bhavati iti hi śrutyantaram adhyakṣa upagāminaḥ sarvān 🔽prāṇān aviśeṣeṇa darśayati /
analyzed: evam eva imam ātmānam antakāle sarve prāṇāḥ abhisāmayanti yatra etat ūrdhva ucchvāsī bhavati iti hi śrutyantaram adhyakṣa upagāminaḥ sarvān  /🔽prāṇān aviśeṣeṇa darśayati
translated: In this very way, all the prāṇas assemble at the end of this self, when one becomes one who breathes upwards. Thus another śruti shows all the prāṇas, without distinction, as going to the overseer.

original: viśeṣeṇa ca 'tamutkrāmantaṃ prāṇo 'nūtkrāmati' bṛ / / /
analyzed: viśeṣeṇa ca tam utkrāmantam prāṇaḥ nu utkrāmati
translated: And in particular, 'When he departs, the vital breath departs after him' (Br. 4.4.1).🔽🔽

original: iti pañcavṛtteḥ prāṇasya adhyakṣa anugāmitāṃ darśayati tat anuvṛttitāṃ ca itareṣām /
analyzed: iti pañca vṛtteḥ prāṇasya adhyakṣa anugāmi tām darśayati tad anuvṛtti tām ca itareṣām
translated: And in particular, the text, 'When he departs, the life-breath departs after him,' Bṛ. , , 0, shows that the all-pervading life-breath follows the Lord, and that the other life-breaths follow it.

original: 'prāṇamanūtkrāmantaṃ sarve prāṇā anūtkrāmati' bṛ / / / iti /
analyzed: prāṇam anūtkrāmantam sarve prāṇāḥ anūtkrāmati bṛ iti
translated: 'When the life-breath departs, all the life-breaths depart after it,' Bṛ. , , 0.

original: 'savijñāno bhavati' iti ca adhyakṣasya antarvijñānavattva pradarśanena tasmin apītakaraṇagrāmasya prāṇasya avasthānaṃ gamayati /
analyzed: sa vijñānaḥ bhavati iti ca adhyakṣasya antar vijñānavat tva pradarśanena tasmin apīta karaṇa grāmasya prāṇasya avasthānam gamayati
translated: And the text, 'He becomes conscious,' Bṛ. , , 0, by showing that the Lord is endowed with internal consciousness, implies that the life-breath, which is the aggregate of the senses, remains in him.

original: nanu prāṇaḥ tejasi iti śrūyate kathaṃ prāṇaḥ adhyakṣa iti adhikāvāpaḥ kriyate /
analyzed: nanu prāṇaḥ tejasi iti śrūyate katham prāṇaḥ adhyakṣaḥ iti adhika āvāpaḥ kriyate
translated: But the text says that the life-breath enters into fire; how then can the life-breath be identified with the Lord?

original: na eṣa doṣaḥ /
analyzed: na eṣa doṣaḥ
translated: This is no objection.

original: adhyakṣapradhānatvāt utkramaṇādivyavahārasya śrutyantaragatasya api ca viśeṣasya apekṣaṇīyatvāt // //
analyzed: adhyakṣa pradhāna tvāt utkramaṇa ādi vyavahārasya śruti antara gatasya api ca viśeṣasya apekṣaṇīya tvāt  /
translated: Because the process of departure, &c, is based on the Lord as the principal factor, and because we have to take into account the particular statement of another scriptural passage, although that passage is not the one under discussion.

original: kathaṃ tarhi prāṇaḥ tejasi iti śrutiḥ iti ata āha
analyzed: katham tarhi prāṇaḥ tejasi iti śrutiḥ iti atas āha
translated: But how then is the text to be interpreted which says that the life-breath enters into fire? To this question the next Sūtra replies

original: bhūteṣu tacchruteḥ / / / /
analyzed: bhūteṣu tad śruteḥ
translated: Because the scriptural passage speaks of it in the elements.

original: sa prāṇasaṃpṛktaḥ adhyakṣaḥ tejaḥsahacariteṣu bhūteṣu dehabījabhūteṣu sūkṣmeṣu avatiṣṭhata iti avagantavyam /
analyzed: sa prāṇa saṃpṛktaḥ adhyakṣaḥ tejaḥ sahacariteṣu bhūteṣu deha bīja bhūteṣu sūkṣmeṣu avatiṣṭhate iti avagantavyam
translated: That overseer, along with the life-force, should be understood to abide in the subtle elements that accompany the fire, which are the seeds of the body.

original: prāṇaḥ tejasi iti śruteḥ /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ tejasi iti śruteḥ
translated: Because of the Vedic text The life-force in the fire.

original: nanu ca iyaṃ śrutiḥ prāṇasya tejasi sthitiṃ darśayati na prāṇasaṃpṛktasya adhyakṣasya /
analyzed: nanu ca iyam śrutiḥ prāṇasya tejasi sthitim darśayati na prāṇa saṃpṛktasya adhyakṣasya
translated: But this Vedic text shows the life-force to abide in the fire, not the overseer connected with the life-force.

original: na eṣa doṣaḥ /
analyzed: na eṣa doṣaḥ
translated: This is not a fault.

original: saḥ adhyakṣa iti adhyakṣasya api antarāle api upasaṃkhyātatvāt /
analyzed: saḥ adhyakṣa iti adhyakṣasya api antarāle api upasaṃkhyāta tvāt
translated: Because the overseer is also included in between.

original: yaḥ api hi srughnānmathurāṃ gatvā mathurāyāḥ pāṭaliputraṃ vrajati saḥ api srughnātpāṭaliputraṃ yāti iti śakyate vaditum /
analyzed: yaḥ api hi srughnāt mathurām gatvā mathurāyāḥ pāṭaliputram vrajati saḥ api srughnāt pāṭaliputram yāti iti śakyate vaditum
translated: For one can say that one who goes from Srughna to Mathura and from Mathura to Pataliputra goes from Srughna to Pataliputra.

original: tasmāt prāṇaḥ tejasi iti prāṇasaṃpṛktasya adhyakṣasya eva etat tejaḥ sahacariteṣu bhūteṣu avasthānam // //
analyzed: tasmāt prāṇaḥ tejasi iti prāṇa saṃpṛktasya adhyakṣasya eva etat tejaḥ sahacariteṣu bhūteṣu avasthānam  /
translated: Therefore, The life-force in the fire refers to the abiding of the overseer connected with the life-force in the elements that accompany the fire.

original: kathaṃ tejaḥsahacariteṣu bhūteṣu iti ucyate yāvat ekameva śrūyate prāṇaḥ tejasi iti /
analyzed: katham tejaḥ sahacariteṣu bhūteṣu iti ucyate yāvat ekam eva śrūyate prāṇaḥ tejasi iti
translated: How is it said to be in the elements that accompany the fire, when only one is heard, The life-force in the fire?

original: ata āha
analyzed: atas āha
translated: To this he says:

original: naikasmin darśayato hi / / / /
analyzed: na ekasmin darśayataḥ hi
translated: For it shows in one, indeed.

original: na ekasmin eva tejasi śarīrāntaraprepsāvelāyāṃ jīvaḥ avatiṣṭhate kāryasya śarīrasya anekātmakatvadarśanāt /
analyzed: na ekasmin eva tejasi śarīra antara prepsā velāyām jīvaḥ avatiṣṭhate kāryasya śarīrasya aneka ātmaka tva darśanāt
translated: The individual soul does not abide in one and the same fire at the time of seeking another body, because the body which is the effect is seen to have many constituents.

original: darśayataḥ ca etam arthaṃ praśnaprativacane 'āpaḥ puruṣavacasaḥ' chā / / / iti /
analyzed: darśayataḥ ca etam artham praśna prativacane āpaḥ puruṣa vacasaḥ chā iti
translated: And the question and answer show this meaning: 'The waters are the voice of the person' (Ch. Up. 8.1.5).

original: tat vyākhyātam 'tryātmakatvāttu bhūyastvāt' bra /sū / / / iti atra /
analyzed: tat vyākhyātam tri ātmaka tvāt tu bhūyaḥ tvāt brasū iti atra
translated: That has been explained here in 'But because of being threefold and because of predominance' (Br. Sū. 1.3.28).

original: śrutismṛtī ca etamarthaṃ darśayataḥ /
analyzed: śruti smṛtī ca etam artham darśayataḥ
translated: And the Śruti and Smṛti show this meaning.

original: śrutiḥ 'pṛthvīmaya āpomayo vāyumaya ākāśamayastojomayaḥ' ityādyā /
analyzed: śrutiḥ pṛthvī mayaḥ āpaḥ mayaḥ vāyu mayaḥ ākāśa mayaḥ tojaḥ mayaḥ ityādyā
translated: The Śruti is: 'Earth-made, water-made, wind-made, space-made, light-made' (Tai. Up. 2.1), and so on.

original: smṛtiḥ api 'aṇvyo mātrāvināśinyo daśārdhānāṃ tu yāḥsmṛtāḥ /
analyzed: smṛtiḥ api aṇvyaḥ mātrā vināśinyaḥ daśārdhānām tu yāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: The Smṛti also is: 'Those which are remembered as the half-units of the ten, indivisible and perishable,

original: tābhiḥ sārdhamidaṃ sarvaṃ saṃbhavatyanupūrvaśaḥ' ityādyā /
analyzed: tābhiḥ sārdham idam sarvam saṃbhavati anupūrvaśas ityādyā
translated: along with them, all this comes into being in due order' (Manu 1.5), and so on.

original: nanu ca upasaṃhṛteṣu vāk ādiṣu karaṇeṣu śarīrāntaraprepsāvelāyāṃ 'kvāyaṃ tadā puruṣo bhavati' bṛ / / /
analyzed: nanu ca upasaṃhṛteṣu vāc ādiṣu karaṇeṣu śarīra antara prepsā velāyām kva ayam tadā puruṣaḥ bhavati
translated: But when the organs such as speech are withdrawn, at the time of seeking another body, 'where does the person become at that time?' (Br. 4.4.1),

original: iti upakramya śrutyantaraṃ karmāśrayatāṃ nirūpayati 'tau ha yadūcatuḥ karma haiva tadūcaturatha ha yatpraśaśaṃsatuḥ karma haiva tatpraśaśaṃsatuḥ'
analyzed: iti upakramya śruti antaram karma āśraya tām nirūpayati tau ha yat ūcatuḥ karma ha eva tat ūcatuḥ atha ha yat praśaśaṃsatuḥ karma ha eva tat praśaśaṃsatuḥ  /
translated: Having begun thus, another Śruti passage determines the dependence on action: They said, 'That which they said is indeed action. Then, that which they praised is indeed action that they praised.'

original: bṛ / / / iti /
analyzed: bṛ iti
translated: (Brhadāranyaka Upaniṣad 4.4.22)

original: atra ucyate tatra karmaprayuktasya graha atigrahasaṃjñakastha indriyaviṣayātmakasya bandhanasya pravṛttiḥ iti karmāśrayatā uktā /
analyzed: atra ucyate tatra karma prayuktasya graha atigraha saṃjñaka stha indriya viṣaya ātmakasya bandhanasya pravṛttiḥ iti karma āśraya tā uktā
translated: To this it is said: There, the occurrence of the bondage called graha and atigraha, which is based on action and consists of the senses and objects, is stated as the dependence on action.

original: iha punaḥ bhūta upādānāt dehāntara utpattiḥ iti bhūtāśrayatvam uktam /
analyzed: iha punar bhūta upādānāt deha antara utpattiḥ iti bhūtāśraya tvam uktam
translated: But here, the dependence on the elements is stated because the origination of another body is from the appropriation of the elements.

original: praśaṃsāśabdāt api tatra prādhānyamātraṃ karmaṇaḥ pradarśitaṃ na tu āśrayāntaraṃ nivāritam /
analyzed: praśaṃsā śabdāt api tatra prādhānya mātram karmaṇaḥ pradarśitam na tu āśraya antaram nivāritam
translated: And from the word 'praise', only the pre-eminence of action is shown there, but another basis is not excluded.

original: tasmāt avirodhaḥ // //
analyzed: tasmāt avirodhaḥ
translated: Therefore there is no contradiction.

original: FN / daśārdhānāṃ pañcabhūtānāṃ /
analyzed: daśārdhānām pañcabhūtānām
translated: The five elements are half of ten.

original: aṇvyaḥ sūkṣmāḥ /
analyzed: aṇvyaḥ sūkṣmāḥ
translated: They are atomic, subtle.

original: mīyanta iti mātrāḥ /🔽āsṛtyupakrama adhikaraṇam / sū /
analyzed: mīyante iti mātrāḥ  āsṛti upakrama adhikaraṇam sū
translated: They are called mātrās because they are measured.🔽The section on the beginning with the elements. Sūtra.

original: samānā cāsṛtyupakramād amṛtatvaṃ cānupoṣya / / / /
analyzed: samānā ca asṛti upakramāt amṛta tvam ca an upoṣya
translated: And immortality is the same because of the beginning with the elements, and without depending on it.

original: sā iyam utkrāntiḥ kiṃ vidvat aviduṣoḥ samānā kiṃvā viśeṣavati iti viśayānānāṃ viśeṣavati iti tāvat prāptam /
analyzed: sā iyam utkrāntiḥ kim vidvat aviduṣoḥ samānā kiṃvā viśeṣavati iti viśayānānām viśeṣavati iti tāvat prāptam
translated: Is this departure the same for the knower and the non-knower, or is it different? Those who differ say it is different.

original: bhūtāśrayaviśiṣṭā hi eṣā /
analyzed: bhūta āśraya viśiṣṭā hi eṣā
translated: This is because it is qualified by the elements as its basis.

original: punaḥ bhavāya ca bhūtāni āśrīyante /
analyzed: punar bhavāya ca bhūtāni āśrīyante
translated: And the elements are resorted to again for rebirth.

original: na ca viduṣaḥ punarbhavaḥ saṃbhavati /
analyzed: na ca viduṣaḥ punarbhavaḥ saṃbhavati
translated: And rebirth is not possible for the knower.

original: 'amṛtatvaṃ hi vidvānaśnute' iti sthitiḥ /
analyzed: amṛta tvam hi vidvān aśnute iti sthitiḥ
translated: For it is established that 'the knower attains immortality.'

original: tasmat aviduṣa eva eṣa utkrāntiḥ /
analyzed: tasmat aviduṣaḥ eva eṣa utkrāntiḥ
translated: Therefore, this departure is only for the non-knower.

original: nanu vidyāprakaraṇe samāmnānāt viduṣa eva eṣā bhavet / na /
analyzed: nanu vidyāprakaraṇe samāmnānāt viduṣaḥ eva eṣā bhavet na
translated: But since it is mentioned in the context of knowledge, it should be only for the knower. No.

original: svāpādivat yathāprāpta anukīrtanāt /
analyzed: svāpa ādi vat yathāprāpta anukīrtanāt
translated: Because it is recounted as it is found, like sleep and so on.🔽For thus, even in the context of knowledge, sleep and so on are recounted as they are common to all living beings: 'When a person here sleeps, named...' 'When he is thirsty, named...'

original: tathā hi 'yatraitatpuruṣaḥ svapiti nāma' 'aśiśiṣati nāma' 'pipāsati nāma' chā / / / /
analyzed: tathā hi yatra etat puruṣaḥ svapiti nāma aśiśiṣati nāma pipāsati nāma
translated: 'When he is hungry, named...'🔽They are not recounted as special to the knower, in accordance with the teaching of the intended subject matter, but as they are found.

original: iti ca sarvaprāṇisādhāraṇā eva svāpādayaḥ anukīrtyante vidyāprakaraṇe api pratipādayiṣitavastupratipādana anuguṇyena na tu viduṣo viśeṣavanto 🔽vidhitsyante /
analyzed: iti ca sarva prāṇi sādhāraṇāḥ eva svāpa ādayaḥ anukīrtyante vidyā prakaraṇe api anuguṇyena na tu viduṣaḥ 🔽vidhitsyante
translated: They are not intended to be enjoined.

original: evam iyam api utkrāntiḥ mahājanagata eva anukīrtyate yasyāṃ parasyāṃ devatāyāṃ puruṣasya prayataḥ tejaḥ saṃpadyate sa ātmā tattvamasi iti etat 🔽pratipādayitum /
analyzed: evam iyam api utkrāntiḥ mahā jana gataḥ eva anukīrtyate yasyām parasyām devatāyām puruṣasya prayataḥ tejaḥ saṃpadyate saḥ ātmā tattvam asi iti etat  / pratipādayitum
translated: Thus, this departure also is described only in the case of the common man, in which the person's tejas becomes united with the supreme deity, in order to teach that 'That is your Self, that is your truth'.

original: pratiṣiddhā ca eṣā viduṣaḥ 'na tasya prāṇā utkrāmanti' bṛ / / / iti /
analyzed: pratiṣiddhā ca eṣā viduṣaḥ na tasya prāṇāḥ utkrāmanti bṛ iti
translated: And this is prohibited in the case of one who knows, 'His vital breaths do not depart' (Br. 3.2.13).

original: tasmāt aviduṣa eva eṣa iti /
analyzed: tasmāt aviduṣaḥ eva eṣa iti
translated: Therefore, this is only for one who does not know.

original: evaṃ prāpte brūmaḥ samānā ca eṣa utkrāntiḥ vāk manasi ityādyā vidvat aviduṣoḥ āsṛti upakramāt bhavitum arhati /
analyzed: evam prāpte brūmaḥ samānā ca eṣa utkrāntiḥ vāc manasi ityādyā vidvat aviduṣoḥ āsṛti upakramāt bhavitum arhati
translated: When this is the case, we say that this departure, beginning with 'Speech merges into mind', should be the same for one who knows and one who does not, because it begins with going.

original: aviśeṣaśravaṇāt /
analyzed: a viśeṣa śravaṇāt
translated: Because it is heard without distinction.

original: aviruddhān dehabījabhūtāni bhūtasūkṣmāṇi āśritya karmaprayukto dehagrahaṇam anubhavituṃ saṃsarati /
analyzed: aviruddhān deha bīja bhūtāni bhūta sūkṣmāṇi āśritya karma prayuktaḥ deha grahaṇam anubhavitum saṃsarati
translated: Depending on the subtle elements of the elements, which are the seeds of the body, and impelled by karma, he wanders to experience the taking of a body.

original: vidvān tu jñānaprakāśitaṃ mokṣanāḍīdvāram āśrayate /
analyzed: vidvān tu jñāna prakāśitam mokṣanāḍīdvāram āśrayate
translated: But one who knows resorts to the door of the path to liberation revealed by knowledge.

original: tat etat āsṛti upakramāt iti uktam /
analyzed: tat etat āsṛti upakramāt iti uktam
translated: This has been said because it begins with going.

original: nanu amṛtatvaṃ hi viduṣā prāptavyaṃ na ca tat deśāntara āyattaṃ tatra kṛto bhūta āśrayatvaṃ sṛti upakramo vā iti /
analyzed: nanu amṛta tvam hi viduṣā prāptavyam na ca tat deśa antare āyattam tatra kṛtaḥ bhūta āśraya tvam sṛti upakramaḥ vā iti
translated: But immortality is to be attained by one who knows, and that is not dependent on a different place. There, what is the use of resorting to the elements or beginning with going?

original: atra ucyate anupoṣya ca idam /
analyzed: atra ucyate anupoṣya ca idam
translated: To this we reply: And this is not observed.

original: adagdhvā atyantam avidyādīn kleśān aparavidyāsāmarthyāt āpekṣikam amṛtatvaṃ prepsate saṃbhavati tatra sṛti upakramo bhūta āśrayatvaṃ ca /
analyzed: a dagdhvā atyantam avidyā ādīn kleśān apara vidyā sāmarthyāt āpekṣikam amṛta tvam prepsate saṃbhavati tatra sṛti upakramaḥ bhūta āśraya tvam ca
translated: Without completely burning away the afflictions such as ignorance, one who desires limited immortality by the power of the other knowledge, it is possible for him to have the beginning of the path and the support of the elements.

original: ne hi nirāśrayāṇāṃ prāṇānāṃ gatiḥ upapadyate /
analyzed: na hi nirāśrayāṇām prāṇānām gatiḥ upapadyate
translated: For the movement of the life-breaths without a support is not possible.

original: tasmāt adoṣaḥ // //
analyzed: tasmāt adoṣaḥ
translated: Therefore there is no fault.

original: saṃsāravyapadeśa adhikaraṇam // sū /
translated: The section on the designation of transmigration.

original: tadāpīteḥ saṃsāravyapadeśāt / / / /
analyzed: tadā apīteḥ saṃsāra vyapadeśāt
translated: Even then, because of the designation of transmigration after the attainment of that state.

original: 'tejaḥ parasyāṃ devatāyām' chā / / /🔽iti atra prakaraṇasāmarthyāt tat yathāprakṛtaṃ tejaḥ sādhyakṣaṃ saprāṇaṃ sakaraṇagrāmaṃ bhūtāntarasahitaṃ prayataḥ puṃsaḥ parasyāṃ devatāyāṃ
analyzed: tejaḥ parasyām devatāyām chā  iti atra prakaraṇa sāmarthyāt tat yathāprakṛtam tejaḥ sa adhyakṣam sa prāṇam sa karaṇa grāmam bhūta antara sahitam prayataḥ puṃsaḥ parasyām devatāyām
translated: In The light in the supreme deity, etc.

original: saṃpadyata iti etat uktaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: saṃpadyate iti etat uktam bhavati
translated: Here, by the power of the context, it is said that the light as it is, along with the embodied soul, life-breath, collection of sense organs, and other elements, of a restrained person, merges into the supreme deity.

original: kīdṛśī punaḥ iyaṃ saṃpattiḥ syāt iti cintyate /🔽tatra ātyantika eva tāvat svarūpapravilaya iti prāptam /
analyzed: kīdṛśī punar iyam saṃpattiḥ syāt iti cintyate  tatra ātyantikaḥ eva tāvat sva rūpa pravilayaḥ iti prāptam
translated: What kind of merger is this? This is being considered.🔽In that regard, it is concluded that it is indeed the complete dissolution of the essential nature.

original: tat prakṛtitva upapatteḥ /
analyzed: tat prakṛti tva upapatteḥ
translated: Because that is logically possible as the primordial nature.

original: sarvasya hi janimato vastujātasya prakṛtiḥ parā devatā iti pratiṣṭhāpitam /
analyzed: sarvasya hi janimataḥ vastu jātasya prakṛtiḥ parā devatā iti pratiṣṭhāpitam
translated: For it has been established that the highest deity is the nature of all the existent things that are born.

original: tasmāt ātyantikīyam avibhāgāpattiḥ iti /
analyzed: tasmāt ātyantikī iyam avibhāga āpattiḥ iti
translated: Therefore, this is the ultimate non-distinction.

original: evaṃ prāpte brūmaḥ tat teja ādi bhūtasūkṣmaṃ śrotrādikaraṇāśrayabhūtamāpīterā saṃsāramokṣāt samyak jñānanimittāt avatiṣṭhate /
analyzed: evam prāpte brūmaḥ tat tejaḥ ādi bhūta sūkṣmam saṃsāra mokṣāt samyak jñāna nimittāt avatiṣṭhate
translated: To this we reply: That subtle element such as fire, which is the basis of the sense organs such as the ear, remains until the liberation from the cycle of birth and death, due to perfect knowledge.

original: 'yonimanye prapadyante śarīratvāya dehinaḥ /
analyzed: yonim anye prapadyante śarīra tvāya dehinaḥ
translated: Others go to wombs for embodiment.

original: sthāṇumanye 'nusaṃyanti yathākarmayathāśrutam' ka / /
analyzed: sthāṇum anye nusaṃyanti yathākarma yathāśrutam ka
translated: Others enter into plants, according to their actions and what they have heard. (Ka. 1.2.4) and so on.

original: ityādi saṃsāravyapadeśāt /
analyzed: ityādi saṃsāra vyapadeśāt
translated: Because of the description of the cycle of birth and death.

original: anyathā hi sarvaḥ prāyaṇasamaya eva upādhipratyastamayāt atyantaṃ brahma saṃpadyeta /
analyzed: anyathā hi sarvaḥ prāyaṇa samayaḥ eva upādhi prati astamayāt atyantam brahma saṃpadyeta
translated: For otherwise, at the time of death, everyone would absolutely merge into Brahman due to the disappearance of the limiting adjuncts.

original: tatra vidhiśāstram anarthakaṃ syāt vidyāśāstraṃ ca /
analyzed: tatra vidhi śāstram anarthakam syāt vidyā śāstram ca
translated: In that case, the injunctions of the scriptures would be meaningless, as well as the scriptures on knowledge.

original: mithyājñānanimittaḥ ca bandho na samyak jñānāt ṛte visraṃsitum arhati /
analyzed: mithyājñāna nimittaḥ ca bandhaḥ na samyak jñānāt ṛte visraṃsitum arhati
translated: And bondage, which is caused by false knowledge, cannot be removed except by perfect knowledge.

original: tasmāt tat prakṛtitve api suṣuptapralayavat bījabhāva avaśeṣa eva eṣā saṃtsapattiḥ iti // //
analyzed: tasmāt tat prakṛti tve api suṣuptapralayavat bījabhāva avaśeṣa eva eṣā saṃtsapattiḥ iti  /
translated: Therefore, even if it is the primordial nature, this merging is like deep sleep or dissolution, with only the seed-state remaining.

original: sūkṣmaṃ pramāṇataś ca tathopalabdheḥ / / / /
analyzed: sūkṣmam pramāṇataḥ ca tathā upalabdheḥ
translated: Subtle, because of the measure, and because of the perception of that.

original: tat ca itarabhūtasahitaṃ tejo jīvasya asmāt śarīrāt pravasata āśrayabhūtaṃ svarūpataḥ pramāṇataḥ ca sūkṣmaṃ bhavitum arhati /
analyzed: tat ca itara bhūta sahitam tejaḥ jīvasya asmāt śarīrāt pravasataḥ āśraya bhūtam svarūpataḥ pramāṇataḥ ca sūkṣmam bhavitum arhati
translated: And that fire, along with the other elements, should be subtle in nature and measure, being the support for the soul's departure from this body.

original: tathā hi nāḍīniṣkramaṇaśravaṇādibhyaḥ asya saukṣmyam upalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi nāḍī niṣkramaṇa śravaṇa ādibhyaḥ asya saukṣmyam upalabhyate
translated: For thus its subtlety is perceived from the hearing of the exit through the channels.

original: tatra tanutvāt saṃcāra upapattiḥ /
analyzed: tatra tanu tvāt saṃcāraḥ upapattiḥ
translated: There, because of its tenuity, its movement is possible.

original: svacchatvāt ca apratīghāta upapattiḥ /
analyzed: svaccha tvāt ca apratīghāta upapattiḥ
translated: And because of its transparency, its unobstructedness is possible.

original: ata eva ca dehāt nirgacchan pārśvasthaiḥ na upalabhyate // //
analyzed: atas eva ca dehāt nirgacchan pārśvasthaiḥ na upalabhyate  /
translated: And for this very reason, when it goes out of the body, it is not perceived by those standing nearby.

original: nopamardenātaḥ / / / /
analyzed: na upamardena atas
translated: Not by destruction, therefore.

original: ata eva sūkṣmatvāt na asya sthūlasya śarīrasya upamardena dāhādinimittena itarat sūkṣmaṃ śarīram upapadyate // //🔽asyaiva copapatter ūṣmā / / / /
analyzed: atas eva sūkṣma tvāt na asya sthūlasya śarīrasya upamardena dāha ādi nimittena itarat sūkṣmam śarīram upapadyate  / asya eva ca upapatteḥ ūṣmā
translated: And for this very reason, because it is subtle, the other subtle body is not produced by the destruction of this gross body, by burning and so on.🔽And because of the possibility of this very [subtle body], heat.

original: asya eva ca sūkṣmasyā śarīrasya eṣa ūṣmā yam etasmin śarīre saṃsparśena ūṣmāṇaṃ vijānanti /
analyzed: asya eva ca sūkṣmasya śarīrasya eṣaḥ ūṣmā yam etasmin śarīre saṃsparśena ūṣmāṇam vijānanti
translated: And this very heat of the subtle body is what they know as heat by contact in this body.

original: tathā hi mṛtāvasthāyām avasthite api dehe vidyamāneṣu api ca rūpādiṣu dehaguṇeṣu
analyzed: tathā hi mṛta avasthāyām avasthite api dehe vidyamāneṣu api ca rūpa ādiṣu deha guṇeṣu
translated: For even when the body remains in the state of death, and even when the qualities of the body such as form and so on exist,

original: na ūṣma upalabhyate jīvat avasthāyām eva tu upalabhyata iti ata dehaguṇeṣu na ūṣma
analyzed: na ūṣma upalabhyate jīvat avasthāyām eva tu upalabhyata iti ata dehaguṇeṣu na ūṣma
translated: Heat is not perceived in the living state, but is perceived only after death. Therefore heat is not a quality of the body.

original: upalabhyate jīvat avasthāyām eva tu upalabhyata iti ata upapadyate prasiddhaśarīravyatiriktavyapāśraya eva eṣa ūṣma iti /
analyzed: upalabhyate jīvat avasthāyām eva tu upalabhyate iti atas upapadyate prasiddha śarīra vyatirikta vyapāśrayaḥ eva eṣaḥ ūṣmaḥ iti
translated: Heat is not perceived in the living state, but is perceived only after death. Therefore it is reasonable that this heat belongs to something other than the well-known body.

original: tathā ca śrutiḥ 'uṣṇa eva jīviṣyañśito mariṣyan iti' // //
analyzed: tathā ca śrutiḥ uṣṇaḥ eva jīviṣyan śitaḥ mariṣyan iti  /
translated: And thus the Śruti says: 'Warm, he will live; cold, he will die.'

original: pratiṣedha adhikaraṇam / sū / 🔽pratiṣedhād iti cen na śārīrāt / / / /
analyzed: pratiṣedha adhikaraṇam sū  pratiṣedhāt iti ced na śārīrāt
translated: The section on the denial of the soul's going out of the body.🔽If it is argued that there is no going out of the body because of the denial of it, that is not so, because it is the embodied Self that is referred to.

original: 'amṛtatvaṃ cānupoṣya' iti ato viśeṣaṇāt ātyantike amṛtatve gati utkrāntyoḥ abhāvo abhyupagataḥ /🔽tatra api kenacit kāraṇena utkrāntim āśaṅkya pratiṣedhati 'athākāmayamāno yo 'kāmo🔽niṣkāma āptakāma ātmakāmo bhavati na tasya prāṇā utkrāmanti brahmaiva sanbrahmāpyeti' bṛ / / /
analyzed: amṛta tvam ca an upoṣya iti atas viśeṣaṇāt ātyantike amṛta tve gati utkrāntyoḥ abhāvaḥ abhyupagataḥ  tatra api kenacid kāraṇena utkrāntim āśaṅkya pratiṣedhati atha a kāmayamānaḥ yaḥ kāmaḥ  niṣkāmaḥ āpta kāmaḥ ātma kāmaḥ bhavati na tasya prāṇāḥ utkrāmanti brahma eva san brahma apyeti bṛ
translated: 'And immortality without attaining' - from this specification, the absence of going out and in of the soul is accepted in absolute immortality.🔽Even there, suspecting going out for some reason, he denies it: 'Now, one who is not desirous, who is desireless, who is free from desires, who has attained his own desire, for him the vital airs do not go out. Being Brahman, he goes to Brahman.'

original: iti ataḥ paravidyāviṣayāt pratiṣedhāt na parabrahmavido dehāt prāṇānām utkrāntiḥ asti iti cet /
analyzed: iti atas para vidyā viṣayāt pratiṣedhāt na para brahma vidaḥ dehāt prāṇānām utkrāntiḥ asti iti ced
translated: Therefore, from this denial in the context of the knowledge of the supreme Self, there is no going out of the vital airs from the body of one who knows the supreme Brahman. If this is argued,🔽then.

original: na iti ucyate /
analyzed: na iti ucyate
translated: No, it is said.

original: yataḥ śārīrāt ātmana eṣa utkrāntipratiṣedhaḥ prāṇānāṃ na śarīrāt /
analyzed: yatas śārīrāt ātmanaḥ eṣaḥ utkrānti pratiṣedhaḥ prāṇānām na śarīrāt
translated: Because this prohibition of the departure of the vital breaths is from the embodied Self, not from the body.

original: katham avagamyate 'na tasmātprāṇā utkrāmanti' iti śākhāntare pañcamī prayogāt /
analyzed: katham avagamyate na tasmāt prāṇāḥ utkrāmanti iti śākhā antare pañcamī prayogāt
translated: How is it understood? From the use of the fifth case in another branch: The vital breaths do not depart from that.

original: saṃbandhasāmānyaviṣayā hi ṣaṣṭhī śākhāntaragatayā pañcamyā saṃbandhaviśeṣe vyavasthāpyate /
analyzed: saṃbandha sāmānya viṣayā hi ṣaṣṭhī śākhā antara gatayā pañcamyā saṃbandha viśeṣe vyavasthāpyate
translated: For the sixth case, which refers to a general relation, is determined in a particular relation by the fifth case in another branch.

original: tasmāt iti ca prādhānyāt abhyudayaniḥśreyasa adhikṛto dehī saṃbadhyate na dehaḥ / na /
analyzed: tasmāt iti ca prādhānyāt abhyudaya niḥśreyasa adhikṛtaḥ dehī saṃbadhyate na dehaḥ na
translated: And because of the primary meaning, the embodied one who is entitled to prosperity and the highest good is connected by from that, not the body. No.

original: tasmāt uccikramiṣoḥ jīvāt prāṇā apakrāmanti saha eva tena bhavanti iti arthaḥ // //
analyzed: tasmāt uccikramiṣoḥ jīvāt prāṇāḥ apakrāmanti saha eva tena bhavanti iti arthaḥ   /
translated: Therefore, when the living being is about to depart, the vital breaths depart from it, the meaning is that they exist along with it.

original: saprāṇasya ca pravasato bhavati utkrāntiḥ dehāt iti evaṃ prāpte prati ucyate
analyzed: sa prāṇasya ca pravasataḥ bhavati utkrāntiḥ dehāt iti evam prāpte prati ucyate
translated: And for one who has vital breaths, there is departure from the body when he goes away. When this is the case, it is replied:

original: spaṣṭo hyekeṣām / / / /
analyzed: spaṣṭaḥ hi ekeṣām
translated: For some, it is indeed clear.

original: na tat asti yat uktaṃ parabrahmavidaḥ api dehāt asti utkrāntiḥ utkrāntipratiṣedhasya deha upādānatvāt iti /
analyzed: na tat asti yat uktam para brahma vidaḥ api dehāt asti utkrāntiḥ utkrānti pratiṣedhasya deha upādāna tvāt iti
translated: That which was said - that even one who knows the supreme Brahman has departure from the body, because the prohibition of departure is based on the body - that is not so.

original: yato deha upādāna eva utkrāntipratiṣedha ekeṣāṃ samāmnātṛṇāṃ spaṣṭa upalabhyate /
analyzed: yatas dehe upādāne eva utkrānti pratiṣedhaḥ ekeṣām samāmnātṛṇām spaṣṭaḥ upalabhyate
translated: For, in the case of some reciters, the denial of the departure of the soul is clearly stated to refer to the body alone.

original: tathā hi ārtabhāgapraśne 'yatrāyaṃ puruṣo mriyata udasmātprāṇāḥ krāmantyāho neti' bṛ / / /🔽iti atra 'neti hovāca yājñavalkyaḥ' bṛ / /
analyzed: tathā hi ārtabhāgapraśne yatra ayam puruṣaḥ mriyate ud asmāt prāṇāḥ krāmanti āho na iti bṛ  iti atra na iti ha uvāca yājñavalkyaḥ bṛ
translated: Thus, in the question of Artabhaga, When this person dies, do the vital breaths depart from him, or not?

original: iti anutkrāntipakṣaṃ parigṛhya na tarhi ayam anutkrānteṣu prāṇeṣu mriyata iti asyām
analyzed: iti an utkrānti pakṣam parigṛhya na tarhi ayam an utkrānteṣu prāṇeṣu mriyate iti asyām
translated: Here, having accepted the view that they do not depart, Yajnavalkya said, No, they do not.

original: āśaṅkāyām 'atraiva samavanīyanta' iti pravilayaṃ prāṇānāṃ pratijñāya tat siddhaye
analyzed: āśaṅkāyām atra eva samavanīyante iti pravilayam prāṇānām pratijñāya tat siddhaye
translated: In this doubt, They merge right there, having promised the dissolution of the vital breaths, for the sake of establishing that,

original: 'sa ucchvayatyādhyātmāyatyādhmāto mṛtaḥ śete' bṛ / / /
analyzed: saḥ ucchvayati adhyātma āyati ādhmātaḥ mṛtaḥ śete
translated: He swells up, and when swollen, the dead man lies down.

original: iti saśabdaparāmṛṣṭasya prakṛtasya utkrānti avadheḥ ucchvayanādīni samāmananti /
analyzed: iti sa śabda parāmṛṣṭasya prakṛtasya utkrānti avadheḥ ucchvayana ādīni samāmananti
translated: They mention the swelling up, etc., of the departure that is referred to by the word sa (he).

original: dehasya ca etāni syuḥ
analyzed: dehasya ca etāni syuḥ
translated: And these would belong to the body,

original: na dehinaḥ /
analyzed: na dehinaḥ
translated: not to the embodied soul.

original: tat sāmānyāt 'na tasmātprāṇā utkrāmantyatraiva samavanīyante' iti atra api abheda upacāreṇa dehāpādānasya eva utkramaṇasya pratiṣedhaḥ /
analyzed: tat sāmānyāt na tasmāt prāṇāḥ utkrāmanti atra eva samavanīyante iti atra api abheda upacāreṇa deha apādānasya eva utkramaṇasya pratiṣedhaḥ
translated: By the analogy of that, here also, by the figurative identification of the non-different, the departure of the body alone is denied: The vital breaths do not depart from him; they merge right there.

original: yadi api prādhānyaṃ dehina iti vyākhyeyaṃ yeṣāṃ pañcamī pāṭhaḥ /
analyzed: yadi api prādhānyam dehinaḥ iti vyākhyeyam yeṣām pañcamī pāṭhaḥ
translated: Although the word ‘dehin’ may be explained as the principal factor, for those who read the locative case.

original: yeṣāṃ tu ṣaṣṭhīpāṭhaḥ teṣāṃ vidvat saṃbandhini utkrāntiḥ pratiṣidhyata iti prāpta utkrāntipratiṣedhārthatvāt asya vākyasya dehapādāna eva sā
analyzed: yeṣām tu ṣaṣṭhī pāṭhaḥ teṣām vidvat saṃbandhini utkrāntiḥ pratiṣidhyate iti prāptaḥ utkrānti pratiṣedha artha tvāt asya vākyasya deha pādāne eva sā
translated: But for those who read the genitive case, it is obtained that the departure of the knower is prohibited. Since this sentence has the purpose of prohibiting departure, that departure is prohibited only for the supporter of the body.

original: pratiṣiddhā bhavati /
analyzed: pratiṣiddhā bhavati
translated: It is prohibited only for the body.

original: dehāt utkrāntiḥ prāptā na dehinaḥ /🔽api ca 'cakṣuṣo vā mūrdhno vānyebhyo vā śarīradeśebhyastamutkrāmantaṃ prāṇo 'nūtkrāmati prāṇo 'nūtkrāmantaṃ sarve prāṇā anūtkrāmanti' bṛ /
analyzed: dehāt utkrāntiḥ prāptā na dehinaḥ  api ca cakṣuṣaḥ vā mūrdhnaḥ vā anyebhyaḥ vā śarīra deśebhyaḥ tam utkrāmantam prāṇaḥ nu utkrāmati prāṇaḥ nu utkrāmantam sarve prāṇāḥ anūtkrāmanti bṛhat
translated: The departure from the body is obtained, not of the embodied one.

original: iti evam avidvat viṣayaṃ saprapañcam utkramaṇaṃ saṃsāragamanaṃ ca darśayitvā 'iti nu kāmayamānaḥ' bṛ / / /
analyzed: iti evam avidvat viṣayam sa prapañcam utkramaṇam saṃsāra gamanam ca darśayitvā iti nu kāmayamānaḥ bṛ
translated: Moreover, after showing in this way the departure with elaboration pertaining to the non-knower and the going to saṃsāra, with the words 'thus one who desires'

original: iti upasaṃhṛtya avidvat kathām 'athākāmayamānaḥ' bṛ / / /
analyzed: iti upasaṃhṛtya avidvat kathām athākāmayamānaḥ bṛ
translated: having concluded the story of the non-knower, with the words 'now one who does not desire'

original: iti vyapadiśya vidvāṃsaṃ yadi tat viṣaye api utkrāntameva prāpadeyasamañjasa eva vyapadeśaḥ syāt /
analyzed: iti vyapadiśya vidvāṃsam yadi tat viṣaye api utkrāntam eva prāpa deya samañjasaḥ eva vyapadeśaḥ syāt
translated: having designated the knower, if he were to speak of the very same departure even in his case, the designation would be quite appropriate.

original: tasmāt avidviṣaye prāptayoḥ gati utkrāntyoḥ vidvat viṣaye pratiṣedha iti evameva vyākhyeyaṃ vyapadeśārthavattvāya /
analyzed: tasmāt avid viṣaye prāptayoḥ gati utkrāntyoḥ vidvat viṣaye pratiṣedha iti evam eva vyākhyeyam vyapadeśa arthavat tvāya
translated: Therefore, the two, departure and arrival, which are possible for one who is not a knower of Brahman, are denied in the case of one who is a knower of Brahman. Thus alone can the explanation be accepted as serving a useful purpose.

original: na ca brahmavidaḥ sarvagatabrahmātmabhūtasya prakṣīṇakāmakarmaṇa utkrāntiḥ gatiḥ vā upapadyate nimitta abhāvāt /
analyzed: na ca brahmavidaḥ sarvagata brahmātma bhūtasya prakṣīṇa kāma karmaṇa utkrāntiḥ gatiḥ vā upapadyate nimitta abhāvāt
translated: And for one who knows Brahman, who has become Brahman which is all-pervading, and whose desires and actions have been destroyed, there can be no departure or arrival, because there is no ground for it.

original: 'atra brahma samaśnute' iti ca evañjātīyakāḥ śrutayo gati utkrāntyoḥ abhāvaṃ sūcayanti // //
analyzed: atra brahma samaśnute iti ca evañjātīyakāḥ śrutayaḥ gati utkrāntyoḥ abhāvam sūcayanti  /
translated: And such passages as, 'Here he enjoys Brahman' (Ch. U. 8. 1. 6), indicate the absence of departure and arrival.

original: smaryate ca / / / /
analyzed: smaryate ca
translated: And it is also remembered.

original: smaryate api ca mahābhārate gati utkrāntyoḥ abhāvaḥ 'sarvabhūtātmabhūtasya samyagbhūtāni paśyataḥ /
analyzed: smaryate api ca mahābhārate gati utkrāntyoḥ abhāvaḥ sarva bhūta ātma bhūtasya samyak bhūtāni paśyataḥ
translated: It is also remembered in the Mahābhārata that there is no departure or arrival for one who knows Brahman: 'For one who has become the Self of all beings, and who sees all beings in himself,

original: devā api mārge muhyantyapadasya padaiṣiṇaḥ' iti /
analyzed: devāḥ api mārge muhyanti apadasya pada eṣiṇaḥ iti
translated: even the gods are confused on the path, seeking the place of the one who has no place.'

original: nanu gatiḥ iti brahmavidaḥ sarvagatabrahmātmabhūtasya smaryate 'śukaḥ kila vaiyāsakirmumukṣurādityamaṇḍalamabhipratasthe pitrā cānugamyāhūto
analyzed: nanu gatiḥ iti brahma vidaḥ sarvagata brahma ātma bhūtasya smaryate śukaḥ kila vaiyāsakiḥ mumukṣuḥ āditya maṇḍalam abhipratasthe pitrā ca anugamya āhūtaḥ
translated: But is it not remembered that one who knows Brahman has an arrival, for it is said that Śuka, the son of Vyāsa, who was desirous of liberation, went towards the orb of the sun, and was called by his father who was following him,

original: bho iti pratiśuśrāva' iti / na /
analyzed: bho iti pratiśuśrāva iti na
translated: and he responded, 'Yes'? No.

original: saśarīrasya eva ayaṃ yogabalena viśiṣṭadeśaprāptipūrvakaḥ śarīra utsarga iti draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: sa śarīrasya eva ayam yoga balena viśiṣṭa deśa prāpti pūrvakaḥ śarīre utsargaḥ iti draṣṭavyam
translated: This should be understood as the casting off of the body by one who is still embodied, preceded by the attainment of a special place by the power of yoga.

original: sarvabhūtadṛśyatvādi upanyāsāt /
analyzed: sarva bhūta dṛśya tva ādi upanyāsāt
translated: Because of the statement that all beings see him.

original: na hi aśarīraṃ gacchantaṃ sarvabhūtāni draṣṭuṃ śaknuyuḥ /
analyzed: na hi aśarīram gacchantam sarva bhūtāni draṣṭum śaknuyuḥ
translated: For all beings cannot see one who goes forth without a body.

original: tathā ca tatra evaupasaṃhṛtam 'śukastu mārutācchīghrāṃ gatiṃ kṛtvāntarikṣagaḥ /
analyzed: tathā ca tatra eva aupasaṃhṛtam śukaḥ tu mārutāt śīghrām gatim kṛtvā antarikṣa gaḥ
translated: And in the same place it is concluded: 'But Suka, moving through the air with a speed greater than that of the wind,

original: darśayitvā prabhāvaṃ svaṃ sarvabhūtagato 'bhavat' iti /
analyzed: darśayitvā prabhāvam svam sarva bhūta gataḥ bhavat iti
translated: having displayed his own power, became one who had entered all beings.'

original: tasmāt abhāvaḥ parabrahmavido gati utkrāntyoḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt abhāvaḥ para brahma vidaḥ gati utkrāntyoḥ
translated: Therefore, there is no going forth for one who knows the supreme Brahman.

original: gatiśrutīnāṃ tu viṣayam upariṣṭāt vyākhyāsyāmaḥ // //
analyzed: gati śrutīnām tu viṣayam upariṣṭāt vyākhyāsyāmaḥ
translated: But we shall explain later on the subject of the passages speaking of going forth.

original: vāgādilaya adhikaraṇam / sū /
analyzed: vāc ādi laya adhikaraṇam sū
translated: The section on the dissolution of speech and so on. Sutra.

original: tāni pare tathā hy āha / / / /
analyzed: tāni pare tathā hi āha  /
translated: They dissolve into the supreme, as it is said thus.

original: tāni punaḥ prāṇaśabdoditāni indriyāṇi bhūtāni ca parabrahmavidaḥ tasmin eva parasmin ātmani pralīyante /
analyzed: tāni punar prāṇa śabda uditāni indriyāṇi bhūtāni ca para brahma vidaḥ tasmin eva parasmin ātmani pralīyante
translated: Moreover, those senses and elements indicated by the word prana of one who knows the supreme Brahman dissolve into that supreme Self itself.

original: kasmāt /
analyzed: kasmāt
translated: Why?

original: tathā hi āha śrutiḥ 'evamevāsya paridraṣṭurimāḥ ṣoḍaśa kalāḥ puruṣāyaṇāḥ puruṣaṃ prāpyāstaṃ gacchanti praśna / / iti /
analyzed: tathā hi āha śrutiḥ evam eva asya paridraṣṭuḥ imāḥ ṣoḍaśa kalāḥ puruṣāyaṇāḥ puruṣam prāpyāḥ tam gacchanti praśnaḥ iti
translated: Because the Shruti says thus: In the same way, these sixteen parts of the observer, having reached the person, disappear into him. (Pra. Up. 6/8)

original: nanu 'gatāḥ kalāḥ pañcadaśa pratiṣṭhāḥ' mu / / /
analyzed: nanu gatāḥ kalāḥ pañcadaśa pratiṣṭhāḥ mu
translated: But it is said in the Upanishad, The fifteen parts have gone to their foundation (Ch. 7.26.2), and The fifteen parts have gone to the moon (Ch. 7.26.2).

original: iti vidvat viṣaya eva aparā śrutiḥ parasmāt ātmanaḥ anyatra api kalānāṃ pralayam āha sma / na /
analyzed: iti vidvat viṣaya eva aparā śrutiḥ parasmāt ātmanaḥ anyatra api kalānām pralayam āha sma na
translated: But, it may be objected, another Vedic text, 'The fifteen parts have gone to their foundation' (Mu. Up. 2.2.5), declares the dissolution of the parts in something other than the highest Self. Not so, we reply.

original: sā khalu vyavahārāpekṣā /
analyzed: sā khalu vyavahāra apekṣā
translated: That text refers to the phenomenal world.

original: pārthivādyāḥ kalāḥ pṛthivyādiḥ eva svaprakṛtīḥ apīyanti iti /
analyzed: pārthiva ādyāḥ kalāḥ pṛthivyādiḥ eva svaprakṛtīḥ apīyanti iti
translated: The parts, earth and so on, dissolve in their own material causes, earth and so on.

original: itarā tu vidvat pratipatti apekṣā /
analyzed: itarā tu vidvat pratipatti apekṣā
translated: The other text, on the other hand, refers to the realization of the wise.

original: kṛtsnaṃ kalājātaṃ parabrahmavido brahma eva saṃpadyata iti /
analyzed: kṛtsnam kalā jātam para brahma vidaḥ brahma eva saṃpadyate iti
translated: It declares that the whole aggregate of parts becomes Brahman itself for one who knows the highest Brahman.

original: tasmāt adoṣaḥ // //🔽avibhāga adhikaraṇam / sū /
analyzed: tasmāt adoṣaḥ  avibhāga adhikaraṇam sū
translated: Therefore there is no fault.🔽The section on non-division. Sutra:

original: avibhāgo vacanāt / / / /
analyzed: avibhāgaḥ vacanāt
translated: Non-division, because of the statement.

original: sa puna viduṣaḥ kalāpralayaḥ kim itareṣām iva sāvaśeṣo bhavati āhosvit niravaśeṣa iti /
analyzed: sa punar viduṣaḥ kalā pralayaḥ kim itareṣām iva sa avaśeṣaḥ bhavati āhosvit niravaśeṣaḥ iti
translated: Now, is that dissolution of the parts for the wise one with a remainder, like for others, or without a remainder?

original: tatra pralayasāmānyāt śakti avaśeṣatāprasaktau bravīti avibhāgāpattiḥ eva iti /
analyzed: tatra pralaya sāmānyāt śakti avaśeṣa tā prasaktau bravīti avibhāga āpattiḥ eva iti
translated: There, due to the general similarity of dissolution, if the possibility of a remainder of power arises, it is said that there is only the attainment of non-division.

original: kutaḥ vacanāt /
analyzed: kutas vacanāt
translated: Why? Because of the statement.

original: tathā hi kalāpralayam uktvā vakti 'bhidyate tāsāṃ nāmarūpe puruṣa ityevaṃ procyate sa eṣo 'kalo 'mṛto bhavati' pra / / iti /
analyzed: tathā hi kalā pralayam uktvā vakti bhidyate tāsām nāma rūpe puruṣaḥ iti evam procyate saḥ eṣa u kalaḥ mṛtaḥ bhavati pra iti
translated: For thus, after declaring the dissolution of the parts, it says, 'Their name and form are divided, thus he is called Purusha. He becomes partless and immortal' (Mu. Up. 2.2.6).

original: avidyā nimittānāṃ ca kalānāṃ na vidyānimitte pralaye sāvaśeṣatva upapattiḥ /
analyzed: avidyā nimittānām ca kalānām na vidyā nimitte pralaye sa avaśeṣa tve upapattiḥ
translated: And it is not possible that the parts of the world, which are produced by Nescience, should remain when the world produced by right knowledge is dissolved.

original: tasmāt avibhāga eva iti // //
analyzed: tasmāt avibhāga eva iti
translated: Therefore there is no difference at all.

original: tadokaḥ adhikaraṇam / sū /
analyzed: tadokaḥ adhikaraṇam sū
translated: The section on the abode of that.

original: tadokograjvalanaṃ tatprakāśitadvāro vidyāsāmarthyāt taccheṣagatyanusmṛtiyogāc ca hārdānugṛhītāḥ śatādhikayā / / / /
analyzed: tad oka ugra jvalanam tad prakāśita dvāraḥ vidyā sāmarthyāt tad śeṣa gati anusmṛti yogāt ca hārda anugṛhītāḥ śata adhikayā
translated: The burning of the highest light, the going out through the door revealed by that, by the power of knowledge, and by the connection with the remembrance of the remaining path of that, the souls are favored by the heart, with the one hundred and one.

original: samāptā prāsaṅgikī paravidyāgatā cintā /
analyzed: samāptā prāsaṅgikī para vidyā gatā cintā
translated: The incidental consideration regarding the supreme knowledge is complete.

original: saṃpratitu aparavidyāviṣayām eva cintām anuvartayati /
analyzed: saṃprati tu apara vidyā viṣayām eva cintām anuvartayati
translated: Now he continues the consideration which is about the lower knowledge.

original: samānā ca asṛti upakramāt vidvat aviduṣoḥ utkrāntiḥiti uktaṃ tam idānīṃ sati upakramaṃ darśayati /
analyzed: samānā ca asṛti upakramāt vidvat aviduṣoḥ utkrāntiḥ iti uktam tam idānīm sati upakramam darśayati
translated: And it has been said that the going out of the knower and the non-knower is the same, beginning with the same path. Now he shows that beginning with the existence.

original: tasya upasaṃhṛtavāgādi kalāpasya uccikramiṣato vijñānātmana oka āyatanaṃ hṛdayam 'sa etāstejomātrāḥ samabhyādadāno hṛdayamevānvavakrāmati' 🔽iti śruteḥ /
analyzed: tasya upasaṃhṛta vāc ādi kalāpasya uccikramiṣataḥ vijñāna ātmanaḥ okaḥ āyatanam hṛdayam saḥ etāḥ tejaḥ mātrāḥ samabhyādadānaḥ hṛdayam eva anvavakrāmati  / iti śruteḥ
translated: The abode of that conscious self whose aggregate of speech etc. has been withdrawn and who is about to go out, is the heart, as stated in the scripture: Taking up these measures of light, he goes along to the heart.

original: tat agraprajvalanapūrvikā cakṣurādisthāna apādānā ca utkrāntiḥ śrūyate 'tasya haitasya
analyzed: tat agra prajvalana pūrvikā cakṣuḥ ādisthāna apādānā ca utkrāntiḥ śrūyate tasya ha etasya
translated: And the going out, which is preceded by the burning of the highest light and the taking away of the abodes of the eye etc., is heard: Of him, of this self,

original: hṛdayasyāgraṃ pradyotate tena pradyotenaiṣa ātmā niṣkrāmati cakṣuṣo vā mūrdhno vānyebhyo🔽vā śarīradeśebhyaḥ' bṛ / / / iti /
analyzed: hṛdayasya agram pradyotate tena pradyotena eṣaḥ ātmā niṣkrāmati cakṣuṣaḥ vā mūrdhnaḥ vā anyebhyaḥ  vā śarīra deśebhyaḥ bṛ iti
translated: The tip of the heart shines forth, and by that light this Self goes out, either through the eye, or through the head, or through other parts of the body.

original: sā kim aniyamena eva vidvat aviduṣoḥ bhavati atha asti kaścit viduṣo viśeṣaniyama🔽iti vicikitsāyāṃ śruti aviśeṣāt aniyamaprāptau ācaṣṭe samā api hi vidvat aviduṣoḥ
analyzed: sā kim aniyamena eva vidvat aviduṣoḥ bhavati atha asti kaścid viduṣaḥ viśeṣa niyama  iti vicikitsāyām śruti aviśeṣāt aniyama prāptau ācaṣṭe samā api hi vidvat a viduṣoḥ
translated: Now, does this shining forth of the heart occur in the same way for the knower and the non-knower, or is there some special rule for the knower?

original: hṛdayāgrapradyotane tat prakāśitadvāratve ca mūrdhasthānāt eva vidvān niṣkrāmati
analyzed: hṛdaya agra pradyotane tad prakāśita dvāra tve ca mūrdha sthānāt eva vidvān niṣkrāmati
translated: With this doubt, since there is no distinction in the scriptures, the rule would be that there is no restriction. But it is said that even in the shining forth of the tip of the heart and in the illumination of the doors, the knower goes out only from the place of the head,

original: sthānāntarebhyaḥ tu itare /
analyzed: sthāna antarebhyaḥ tu itare
translated: but others from other places.

original: kutaḥ vidyāsāmarthyāt /
analyzed: kutas vidyā sāmarthyāt
translated: Why? Because of the power of knowledge.

original: yadi vidvān apītaravat yataḥ kutaścit dehadeśāt utkrāmeta na eva utkṛṣṭaṃ lokaṃ labheta /
analyzed: yadi vidvān api itara vat yatas kutaścid deha deśāt utkrāmeta na eva utkṛṣṭam lokam labheta
translated: If the knower were to go out from any part of the body like others, he would not attain the exalted world.

original: tatra ānarthikā eva vidyā syāt /
analyzed: tatra ānarthikā eva vidyā syāt
translated: In that case, knowledge would be useless.

original: tat śeṣagati anusmṛtiyogāt ca vidyāśeṣabhūtā ca mūrdhani anāḍīsaṃbaddhā gatiḥ anuśīlayitavyā vidyāviśeṣeṣu vihitā tām abhyasyan tasya eva pratiṣṭhita
analyzed: tad śeṣa gati anusmṛti yogāt ca vidyā śeṣa bhūtā ca mūrdhani anāḍīsaṃbaddhā gatiḥ anuśīlayitavyā vidyā viśeṣeṣu vihitā tām abhyasyan tasya eva pratiṣṭhita
translated: And because of the connection with the remembrance of the path that remains, the path connected with the head, which is a remnant of knowledge, should be followed. It is enjoined in the special knowledges. Practicing that, he is established in that itself.

original: iti yuktam /
analyzed: iti yuktam
translated: This is proper.

original: tasmāt hṛdayālayena brahmaṇā su upāsitena anugṛhītaḥ tadbhāvaṃ samāpanno vidvān mūrdhanyayā eva śatādhikayā śatāt atiriktayā ekaśatatamyā nāḍyā
analyzed: tasmāt hṛdayālayena brahmaṇā su upāsitena anugṛhītaḥ tadbhāvam samāpannaḥ vidvān mūrdhanyayā eva śata adhikayā śatāt atiriktayā ekaśatatamyā nāḍyā  /
translated: Therefore, the learned one, favored by Brahman residing in the heart, well-worshipped, and attained to its state, departs through the same hundred-and-one-fold channel, with one hundred and one, exceeding the hundred.

original: niṣkrāmati itarābhiḥ itare /
analyzed: niṣkrāmati itarābhiḥ itare
translated: Others depart through other channels.

original: tathā hi hārdavidyāṃ prakṛtya samāmananti 'śataṃ caikā ca hṛdayasya nāḍyastāsāṃ mūrdhānamabhiniḥsṛtaikā /
analyzed: tathā hi hārda vidyām prakṛtya samāmananti śatam ca ekā ca hṛdayasya nāḍyaḥ tāsām mūrdhānam abhiniḥsṛtā ekā
translated: For thus, with reference to the knowledge of the heart, they recite: 'There are a hundred and one channels of the heart. Of them, one goes out through the top of the head.

original: tayordhvamāyannamṛtatvameti viṣvaṅṅnyā utkrameṇa bhavanti' chā / / / iti // //🔽raśmi adhikaraṇam / sū /
analyzed: tayā ūrdhvam āyan amṛta tvam eti viṣvaṅ nyāḥ utkrameṇa bhavanti chā  iti  raśmi adhikaraṇam sū
translated: Going upwards through that, one attains immortality. The others are for going in all directions by turns.'🔽The section on the rays.

original: raśmyanusārī / / / /
analyzed: raśmi anusārī
translated: Following the rays.

original: asti hārdavidyā 'atha yadidamasminbrahmapure daharaṃ puṇḍarīkaṃ veśma' chā / / /
analyzed: asti hārdavidyā atha yat idam asmin brahma pure daharam puṇḍarīkam veśma chā
translated: There is the knowledge of the heart, beginning with 'Now, this small lotus-like house in this city of Brahman' (Ch. U. 8.1.1).

original: iti upakramya vihitā /🔽tat prakriyāyām 'atha yā etā hṛdayasya nāḍyaḥ' chā / / /
analyzed: iti upakramya vihitā  tat prakriyāyām atha yā etā hṛdayasya nāḍyaḥ chā
translated: It is enjoined.🔽In its exposition, beginning with 'Now, these are the channels of the heart' (Ch. U. 8.6.1),

original: iti upakramya saprapañcaṃ nāḍīraśmisaṃbandham uktvā uktam 'atha yatraitadasmāccharīrādutkrāmatyathaitaireva raśmibhirūrdhvamākramate' chā / 🔽iti /
analyzed: iti upakramya sa prapañcam nāḍī raśmi saṃbandham uktvā uktam atha yatra etat asmāt śarīrāt utkrāmati atha etaiḥ eva raśmibhiḥ ūrdhvam ākramate chā  /🔽iti
translated: having described in detail the connection of the channels with the rays, it is said: 'Now, when it departs from this body, then it ascends upwards by those same rays' (Ch. U. 8.6.6).

original: punaḥ ca uktam 'tayordhvamāyannamṛtatvameti' chā / / / iti /
analyzed: punar ca uktam tayā ūrdhvam āyan amṛta tvam eti chā iti
translated: And again it is said: 'Going upwards from them, he attains immortality' (Ch. Up. 8.6.6).

original: tasmāt śatādhikayā nāḍyā niṣkrāman raśmi anusārī niṣkrāmati iti gamyate /
analyzed: tasmāt śata adhikayā nāḍyā niṣkrāman raśmi anusārī niṣkrāmati iti gamyate
translated: Therefore it is understood that one who departs through the nāḍī exceeding a hundred departs following the rays.

original: tat kiṃm aviśeṣeṇa eva ahani rātrau vā mriyamāṇasya raśmi anusāritvam āhosvit ahani eva iti saṃśaye sati aviśeṣaśravaṇāt aviśeṣeṇa eva tāvat
analyzed: tat kim aviśeṣeṇa eva ahani rātrau vā mriyamāṇasya raśmi anusāri tvam āhosvit ahani eva iti saṃśaye sati aviśeṣa śravaṇāt aviśeṣeṇa eva tāvat
translated: Now, is it that one who dies, whether by day or by night, follows the rays, or only by day? This being the doubt, because of the hearing without distinction, it is asserted that without distinction,

original: raśmi anusāri iti pratijñāyate // //
analyzed: raśmi anusāri iti pratijñāyate  /
translated: one follows the rays.

original: niśi neti cen na sambandhasya yāvaddehabhāvitvād darśayati ca / / / /
analyzed: niśi nā iti ced na sambandhasya yāvaddehabhāvi tvāt darśayati ca
translated: If it be said that it is not so by night, it is not so, because the connection lasts as long as the body does, and it is shown.

original: asti ahani nāḍīraśmisaṃbandha iti ahani mṛtasya syāt raśmi anusāritvaṃ rātrau tu pretasya na syāt /
analyzed: asti ahani nāḍī raśmi saṃbandhaḥ iti ahani mṛtasya syāt raśmi anusāri tvam rātrau tu pretasya na syāt
translated: There is the connection of the nāḍīs with the rays by day, so for one who dies by day there would be following the rays, but for one who dies by night there would not be.

original: nāḍīraśmisaṃbandhavicchedāt iti cet / na /🔽nāḍīraśmisaṃbandhasya yāvat dehabhāvitvāt /
analyzed: nāḍī raśmi saṃbandha vicchedāt iti ced na  nāḍī raśmi saṃbandhasya yāvat deha bhāvi tvāt
translated: If it be said that it is because of the cessation of the connection of the nāḍīs with the rays, it is not so.🔽Because the connection of the nāḍīs with the rays lasts as long as the body does.

original: yāvat dehabhāvī hi śirākiraṇasaṃparkaḥ /
analyzed: yāvat deha bhāvī hi śirā kiraṇa saṃparkaḥ
translated: For the contact of the nāḍīs with the rays lasts as long as the body does.

original: darśayati ca etamarthaṃ śrutiḥ 'amuṣmādādityātpratāyante tā āsu nāḍīṣu sṛptā ābhyo nāḍībhyaḥ pratāyante te 'muṣminnāditye sṛptāḥ' chā / / /
analyzed: darśayati ca etam artham śrutiḥ amuṣmāt ādityāt pratāyante tāḥ āsu nāḍīṣu sṛptāḥ ābhyaḥ nāḍībhyaḥ pratāyante te muṣmin āditye sṛptāḥ chā
translated: And the Śruti also declares this meaning: 'From that sun they spread out, and having entered those channels, they spread out from those channels and enter that sun.'

original: iti nidāghasamaye ca niśāsu api kiraṇa anuvṛttiḥ upalabhyate pratāpādikāryadarśanāt /
analyzed: iti nidāgha samaye ca niśāsu api kiraṇa anuvṛttiḥ upalabhyate pratāpa ādi kārya darśanāt
translated: And even during the nights of summer, the continuation of the rays is perceived, because the effects such as heat are seen.

original: stoka anuvṛtteḥ tu durlakṣyatvam ṛtvantararajanīṣu śaiśireṣu iva durdineṣu /
analyzed: stoka anuvṛtteḥ tu durlakṣya tvam ṛtu antararajanīṣu śaiśireṣu iva durdineṣu
translated: But because of the small continuation, it is difficult to observe, like during the nights of other seasons, during the cold ones, or during cloudy days.

original: 'aharevaitadrātrau dadhāti' iti ca etadeva darśayati /
analyzed: ahar eva etat rātrau dadhāti iti ca etat eva darśayati
translated: And the text 'He places that night in the day' shows this very thing.

original: yadi ca rātrau preto vinā eva raśmi anusāreṇa ūrdhvam ākrameta raśmi anusāra ānarthakyaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: yadi ca rātrau pretaḥ vinā eva raśmi anusāreṇa ūrdhvam ākrameta raśmi anusāra ānarthakyam bhavet
translated: And if one who departs at night were to ascend upwards without even following the rays, then following the rays would be pointless.

original: na hi etat viśiṣya adhīyate yo divā praiti sa raśmīn apekṣya ūrdvam ākramate yaḥ tu rātrau saḥ anapekṣya eva iti /
analyzed: na hi etat viśiṣya adhīyate yaḥ divā praiti sa raśmīn apekṣya ūrdvam ākramate yaḥ tu rātrau saḥ an apekṣya eva iti
translated: For this is not studied with a distinction: 'One who departs during the day ascends upwards depending on the rays, but one who departs at night does so without depending on them.'

original: atha tu vidvān api rātriprāyaṇa aparādhamātreṇa na ūrdhvam ākrameta pākṣikaphalā vidyā iti apravṛttiḥ eva tasyāṃ syāt /
analyzed: atha tu vidvān api rātri prāyaṇa aparādha mātreṇa na ūrdhvam ākrameta pākṣika phalā vidyā iti apravṛttiḥ eva tasyām syāt
translated: But if even a knower does not ascend upwards merely due to the fault of departing at night, then the knowledge would have results only sometimes, and there would be no engagement in it at all.

original: mṛtyukālāniyamāt /
analyzed: mṛtyu kāla aniyamāt
translated: Because the time of death is not fixed.

original: atha api rātrau uparataḥ aharāgamam udīkṣeta /
analyzed: atha api rātrau uparataḥ aharāgamam udīkṣeta
translated: Even if one were to desist at night and look forward to the coming of day,

original: aharāgame api asya kadācit araśmisaṃbandhārhaṃ śarīraṃ syāt pāvakādisaṃparkāt /🔽'sa yāvatkṣipyenmanastāvadādityaṃ gacchati' chā / / /
analyzed: ahar āgame api asya kadācid a raśmi saṃbandha arham śarīram syāt pāvaka ādi saṃparkāt  sa yāvat kṣipyet manaḥ tāvat ādityam gacchati chā
translated: at the coming of day, his body might sometimes be unfit for contact with the rays, due to contact with fire etc.

original: iti ca śrutiḥ anudīkṣāṃ darśayati /
analyzed: iti ca śrutiḥ anudīkṣām darśayati
translated: And the Śruti shows non-looking: As far as one can throw the mind, one goes to the sun (Chāndogya Upaniṣad 5.10.1).

original: tasmāt tat aviśeṣeṇa eva idaṃ rātridivaṃ raśmi anusāritvam // //
analyzed: tasmāt tat aviśeṣeṇa eva idam rātri divam raśmi anusāri tvam  /
translated: Therefore, this following of the rays is to be done day and night without distinction.

original: dakṣiṇāyana adhikaraṇam / sū /
analyzed: dakṣiṇāyana adhikaraṇam sū
translated: The section on the southern solstice. Sūtra.

original: ataś cāyane 'pi dakṣiṇe / / / /
analyzed: atas ca ayane pi dakṣiṇe  /
translated: And therefore, even in the southern solstice.

original: ata eva ca udīkṣā anupapatteḥ apākṣikaphalatvāt ca vidyāyā aniyatakālatvāt ca mṛtyoḥ dakṣiṇa ayane api mriyamāṇo vidvān prāpnoti eva vidyāphalam
analyzed: atas eva ca udīkṣā anupapatteḥ apākṣika phala tvāt ca vidyāyāḥ aniyata kāla tvāt ca mṛtyoḥ dakṣiṇa ayane api mriyamāṇaḥ vidvān prāpnoti eva vidyā phalam
translated: And for this very reason, because looking forward is not possible, because the result of the knowledge is not dependent on the solstice, and because death is not fixed in time, the learned person who dies even in the southern solstice attains the fruit of knowledge.

original: uttarāyaṇa maraṇa prāśasti aprasiddherbhīṣmasya ca pratīkṣādarśanāt 'āpūryamāṇapakṣādyānṣaḍudaṅṅeti māsāṃstān' chā / / /
analyzed: uttarāyaṇa maraṇa prāśasti aprasiddheḥ bhīṣmasya ca pratīkṣā darśanāt āpūryamāṇapakṣāt yān ṣaṭ udaṅ eti māsān tān chā
translated: Because the excellence of dying in the northern solstice is not well-known, and because Bhīṣma is seen to have waited, and because of the Śruti: The months in which the sun moves northwards, beginning with the waxing fortnight, (Bṛhadāraṇyaka Upaniṣad 6.3.15),

original: iti ca śruteḥ apekṣitavyam uttarāyaṇam iti imām āśaṅkām anena sūtreṇa apanudati /
analyzed: iti ca śruteḥ apekṣitavyam uttarāyaṇam iti imām āśaṅkām anena sūtreṇa apanudati
translated: the northern solstice should be awaited. This doubt is removed by this sūtra.

original: prāśastyaprasiddhiḥ avidvat viṣayā /
analyzed: prāśastya prasiddhiḥ avidvat viṣayā
translated: The well-known excellence of the path of the gods is for those who are not learned.

original: bhīṣmasya pratipālanam ācārapratipālanārthaṃ pitṛprasādalabdhasvacchandamṛtyutākhyāpanārthaṃ ca /
analyzed: bhīṣmasya pratipālanam ācāra pratipālana artham pitṛ prasāda labdha svacchanda mṛtyu tā khyāpana artham ca
translated: Bhishma's waiting is for the purpose of observing the practice of the elders and for the purpose of proclaiming his own death at will, obtained through the grace of his father.

original: śruteḥ tu arthaṃ vakṣyati 'ātivāhikāstalliṅgāt' bra / sū / / / iti // //
analyzed: śruteḥ tu artham vakṣyati ātivāhikāḥ tad liṅgāt iti  /
translated: But the meaning of the Veda will be stated thus: The Vaikhanasa [sages] are indicated by that [scripture].

original: nanu ca 'yatra kāle tvanāvṛttimāvṛttiṃ caiva yoginaḥ /
analyzed: nanu ca yatra kāle tu anāvṛttim āvṛttim ca eva yoginaḥ
translated: But how can one who departs at night or in the southern solstice go to non-return, when in the Smriti, beginning with the primacy of time thus: At the time when the yogis go to non-return and return,

original: prayātā yānti taṃ phalaṃ vakṣyāmi bharatarṣabha' gī / /🔽iti kālaprādhānyena upakramya aharādikālaviśeṣaḥ smṛtau apunarāvṛttaye niyamitaḥ kathaṃ rātrau dakṣiṇāyane vā prayāto anāvṛttiṃ yāyāditi /
analyzed: prayātāḥ yānti tam phalam vakṣyāmi bharata ṛṣabha  iti kāla prādhānyena upakramya ahar ādi kāla viśeṣaḥ smṛtau apunarāvṛttaye niyamitaḥ katham rātrau dakṣiṇāyane vā prayātaḥ anāvṛttim yāyāt iti
translated: I will declare that fruit, O best of the Bharata race, a particular time such as daytime is restricted for non-return?

original: atra ucyate
analyzed: atra ucyate
translated: To this it is said:

original: yoginaḥ prati ca smaryete smārte caite / / / /
analyzed: yoginaḥ prati ca smaryete smārte ca ete
translated: And they are remembered for the yogis, and these are based on Smriti.

original: yoginaḥ prati ca ayam aharādikālaviniyogaḥ anāvṛttaye smaryate /
analyzed: yoginaḥ prati ca ayam ahar ādi kāla viniyogaḥ anāvṛttaye smaryate
translated: This restriction of time such as daytime for non-return is remembered for the yogis.

original: smārte ca ete yogasāṃkhye na śraute /
analyzed: smārte ca ete yoga sāṃkhye na śraute
translated: And these Yoga and Sankhya are based on Smriti, not on the Vedas.

original: ato viṣayabhedāt pramāṇāviśeṣāt ca na asya smārtasya kālaviniyogasya śrauteṣu vijñāneṣu avatāraḥ /
analyzed: atas viṣaya bhedāt pramāṇa aviśeṣāt ca na asya smārtasya kāla viniyogasya śrauteṣu vijñāneṣu avatāraḥ
translated: Therefore, due to the difference in objects and the non-distinction of the means of knowledge, this temporal restriction of the smrti does not apply to the Vedic knowledges.

original: nanu 'agnirjyotirahaḥ śuklaḥ ṣaṇmāsā uttarāyaṇam' /
analyzed: nanu agniḥ jyotiḥ ahar śuklaḥ ṣaṭ māsāḥ uttarāyaṇam
translated: Therefore, because of the difference of subject-matter and the non-difference of the means of knowledge, this injunction of time in the Smṛti has no application to the cognitions enjoined by the Śruti.🔽But these two paths, the path of the gods and the path of the manes, are recognized in the Smṛti also, as in the Śruti: 'Fire, light, day, the bright fortnight, the six months when the sun moves north,

original: 'dhūmo rātristathā kṛṣṇaḥ ṣaṇmāsā dakṣiṇāyanam' gī / / /🔽iti ca śrautau etau devayānapitṛyāṇau pratyabhijñāyete smṛtau api iti /
analyzed: dhūmaḥ rātriḥ tathā kṛṣṇaḥ ṣaṣ māsāḥ dakṣiṇāyanam  iti ca śrautau etau deva yāna pitṛyāṇau pratyabhijñāyete smṛtau api iti
translated: Smoke, night, the dark fortnight, the six months when the sun moves south' (Gītā 8.24-25).

original: ucyate 'taṃ kālaṃ vakṣyāmi' gī / /
analyzed: ucyate tam kālam vakṣyāmi
translated: It is said: 'I will tell you about that time' (Gītā 8.24).

original: iti smṛtau kālapratijñānāt virodham āśaṅkya parihāra uktaḥ /
analyzed: iti smṛtau kāla pratijñānāt virodham āśaṅkya parihāraḥ uktaḥ
translated: Since the Smṛti promises to speak about time, a contradiction is suspected and a solution is given.

original: yadā punaḥ smṛtau api agnyādyā devatā eva ativāhikyo gṛhyante tadā na kaścit virodha iti // //
analyzed: yadā punar smṛtau api agni ādyāḥ devatāḥ eva ativāhikyaḥ gṛhyante tadā na kaścid virodhaḥ iti  /
translated: But when even in the Smṛti, the deities beginning with fire are accepted as conveyors, then there is no contradiction at all.

original: iti śrīmatparamahaṃsaparivrājakācāryaśrīmacchaṅkarabhagavataḥ kṛtau śārīrakamīmāṃsābhāṣye caturthādhyāyasya dvitīyaḥ pādaḥ // //🔽caturthe 'dhyāye tṛtīyaḥ pādaḥ /🔽atra pāde saguṇavidyāvato mṛtasya uttaramārga abhidhānam
analyzed: iti śrīmat paramahaṃsa parivrājaka ācārya śrīmat śaṅkara bhagavataḥ kṛtau śārīraka mīmāṃsā bhāṣye caturtha adhyāyasya dvitīyaḥ pādaḥ  /🔽caturthe dhyāye tṛtīyaḥ pādaḥ 🔽atra pāde sa guṇa vidyāvataḥ mṛtasya uttara mārge abhidhānam
translated: Thus ends the second chapter of the fourth section in the commentary of Śrī Śaṅkarabhagavatpāda on the Śārīraka-Mīmāṃsā.

original: arcirādi adhikaraṇam / sū /🔽arcirādinā tatprathiteḥ / / / /
analyzed: arcis ādi adhikaraṇam sū  arciḥ ādinā tad prathiteḥ
translated: The section on the path beginning with light. Sutra.🔽Because it is well-known through the path beginning with light.

original: āsṛti upakramāt samāna utkrāntiḥ iti uktam /
analyzed: āsṛti upakramāt samāna utkrāntiḥ iti uktam
translated: It has been said that the upward movement is the same as the upward movement mentioned in the beginning of the Taittiriya Upanishad.

original: sṛtistu śrutyantareṣu anekadhā śrūyate /🔽nāḍīraśmisaṃbandhena ekadhā 'athaitaireva raśmibhirūrdhva ākramate' chā / / / iti /
analyzed: sṛtiḥ tu śruti antareṣu anekadhā śrūyate  nāḍī raśmi saṃbandhena ekadhā atha etaiḥ eva raśmibhiḥ ūrdhve ākramate chā iti
translated: But in other scriptures, the path is heard in many ways.🔽In one place, it is said to be through the connection with the channels and rays: Then he ascends upwards by these very rays (Ch. Up. 8.6.2).

original: arcirādika ekā 'te 'rciṣamabhisaṃbhavantyarciṣo 'haḥ' bṛ / / / iti /
analyzed: arciḥ ādikaḥ ekā te rciṣam abhisaṃbhavanti arciṣaḥ haḥ bṛ iti
translated: In another place, it is said to be through the path beginning with light: They enter the light, from the light the day (Bhag. Giti 8.24).

original: 'sa etaṃ devayānaṃ panthānamāsādyāgnilokamāgacchati' kau / / iti anyā /
analyzed: saḥ etam deva yānam panthānam āsādya agni lokam āgacchati kau iti anyā
translated: In another place, it is said to be through the path of the gods: Having reached this path of the gods, he goes to the world of Agni (Ka. Up. 2.3).

original: 'yadā vai puruṣo 'smāllokātpraiti sa vāyumāgacchati' bṛ / / / iti aparā /
analyzed: yadā vai puruṣaḥ smāt lokāt praiti sa vāyum āgacchati iti aparā
translated: In another place, it is said to be through the wind: When a person departs from this world, he goes to the wind (Bhag. Giti 8.24).

original: 'sūryadvāreṇa te virajāḥ prayānti' muṇḍa / / /
analyzed: sūrya dvāreṇa te virajāḥ prayānti muṇḍa
translated: In another place, it is said to be through the sun: Those who are free from passion go through the door of the sun (Mund. Up. 2.2.7).

original: iti ca aparā /
analyzed: iti ca aparā
translated: And in another place.

original: tatra saṃśayaḥ kiṃ parasparaṃ bhinnā etāḥ sṛtaya kiṃ va eka eva anekaviśeṣaṇa iti /
analyzed: tatra saṃśayaḥ kim parasparam bhinnāḥ etāḥ sṛtayaḥ kim vaḥ ekaḥ eva aneka viśeṣaṇaḥ iti
translated: There is doubt - are these paths mutually different, or is there only one path with many specifications?

original: tatra prāptaṃ tāvat bhinnāḥ etāḥ sṛtaya iti /🔽bhinnaprakaraṇatvāt /
analyzed: tatra prāptam tāvat bhinnāḥ etāḥ sṛtayaḥ iti  bhinna prakaraṇa tvāt
translated: Regarding this, it is first concluded that these paths are different.🔽Because they are in different sections.

original: bhinna upāsanāśeṣatvāt ca /
analyzed: bhinna upāsana aśeṣa tvāt ca
translated: And because they are the remnants of different meditations.

original: api ca 'athaitaireva raśmibhiḥ'chā / / /
analyzed: api ca atha etaiḥ eva raśmibhiḥ chā
translated: Moreover, Then by these very rays (Ch. Up. 8.6.2).

original: iti avadhāraṇam arcirādi apekṣāyām uparudhyeta /
analyzed: iti avadhāraṇam arcirādi apekṣāyām uparudhyeta
translated: Thus the restriction would be set aside in the case of the dependence on the light etc.

original: tvarāvacanaṃ ca pīḍyeta 'sa yāvatkṣipyenmanastāvadādityaṃ gacchati' chā / / / iti /
analyzed: tvarā vacanam ca pīḍyeta sa yāvat kṣipyet manaḥ tāvat ādityam gacchati chā iti
translated: And the statement of haste would be contradicted: As long as he would direct his mind, for so long he goes to the sun.

original: tasmāt anyonyabhinnā eva ete panthāna iti /
analyzed: tasmāt anyonya bhinnāḥ eva ete panthānaḥ iti
translated: Therefore, these paths are indeed mutually distinct.

original: evaṃ prāpte abhidadhmahe arcirādina iti sarvo brahmaprepsuḥ arcirādina eva adhvanā raṃhati iti pratijānīmahe /
analyzed: evam prāpte abhidadhmahe arciḥ ādinaḥ iti sarvaḥ brahma prepsuḥ arciḥ ādinaḥ eva adhvanā raṃhati iti pratijānīmahe
translated: When this has been reached, we declare: By the light etc. We assert that all who desire to go to Brahman go by the path beginning with light.

original: kutaḥ tat prathiteḥ /
analyzed: kutas tat prathiteḥ
translated: Why? Because it is well-known.

original: prathito hi eṣa mārgaḥ sarveṣāṃ viduṣām /
analyzed: prathitaḥ hi eṣa mārgaḥ sarveṣām viduṣām
translated: For this path is well-known to all the wise.

original: tathā hi pañcāgnividyāprakaraṇe 'ye 'cāmī araṇye śraddhāṃ satyamupāsate' bṛ / / /
analyzed: tathā hi pañcāgni vidyā prakaraṇe ye ca amī araṇye śraddhām satyam upāsate
translated: Thus, in the section on the knowledge of the five fires, it is said: Those who in the forest worship faith and truth (Brh.

original: iti vidyāntaraśīlinām api arcirādikā sṛtiḥ śrāvyate /
analyzed: iti vidyā antara śīlinām api arciḥ ādikā sṛtiḥ śrāvyate
translated: Thus, even for those who possess other knowledge, the path beginning with light is declared.

original: syāt etat /
analyzed: syāt etat
translated: This may be the case.

original: yāsu vidyāsu na kācit gatiḥ ucyate tāsu iyam arcirādika upatiṣṭhatāṃ yāsu tu anyā śrāvyate tāsu kim iti arcirādi āśrayaṇam iti /
analyzed: yāsu vidyāsu na kācid gatiḥ ucyate tāsu iyam arcirādikaḥ upatiṣṭhatām yāsu tu anyā śrāvyate tāsu kim iti arcirādi āśrayaṇam iti
translated: In those knowledges where no path is mentioned, this beginning with light may be accepted. But in those where another is declared, why resort to light etc.?

original: atra ucyate bhavet etadevaṃ yadi atyantabhinnā eva etāḥ sṛtayaḥ syuḥ /
analyzed: atra ucyate bhavet etat evam yadi atyanta bhinnāḥ eva etāḥ sṛtayaḥ syuḥ
translated: To this it is said: This would be so if these paths were absolutely distinct.

original: eka eva tu eṣā sṛtiḥanekaviśeṣaṇā brahmalokaprapadanī kvacit kenacit viśeṣaṇena upalakṣita iti vadāmaḥ /🔽sarvatra ekadeśapratyabhijñānāt itaretara viśeṣaṇaviśeṣyabhāva upapatteḥ /🔽prakaraṇabhede api hi vidyā ekatve bhavati itaretara viśeṣaṇa upasaṃhāravat gativiśeṣaṇānām api upasaṃhāraḥ /
analyzed: ekaḥ eva tu eṣā sṛtiḥ aneka viśeṣaṇā brahma loka prapadanī kvacid kenacid viśeṣaṇena upalakṣita iti vadāmaḥ  sarvatra eka deśa pratyabhijñānāt itaretara viśeṣaṇa viśeṣya bhāva upapatteḥ  prakaraṇa bhede api hi vidyā ekatve bhavati itaretara viśeṣaṇa upasaṃhāravat gati viśeṣaṇānām api upasaṃhāraḥ
translated: But we maintain that this one path to the world of Brahman is indicated by various qualifications in different places.🔽For everywhere there is recognition of a part, and thus the relation of qualification and qualified is possible.🔽Even when there is a difference of context, when the knowledge is one, there is inclusion of the qualifications for each other, just as there is inclusion of the qualifications for the particular path.

original: vidyābhede api tu gati ekadeśapratyabhijñānāt gantavya abhedāt ca gati abheda eva /
analyzed: vidyā bhede api tu gati eka deśa pratyabhijñānāt gantavya abhedāt ca gati abheda eva
translated: But even when there is a difference of knowledge, there is non-difference of the path, because of the recognition of a part of the path and because of the non-difference of the goal to be reached.🔽For thus, in various places, it is shown that the same one result, characterized by the attainment of the world of Brahman, is

original: tathā hi 'te teṣu brahmalokeṣu parāḥ parāvato vasanti' bṛ / / /
analyzed: tathā hi te teṣu brahma lokeṣu parāḥ parāvataḥ vasanti
translated: 'They dwell in those worlds of Brahman, higher and beyond the highest.'

original: 'tasminvasanti śāśvatīḥ samāḥ' bṛ / /
analyzed: tasmin vasanti śāśvatīḥ samāḥ bṛ
translated: 'In that (world) they dwell for eternal years.'

original: 'sā yā brahmaṇo jitiryā vyuṣṭistāṃ jitiṃ jayati tāṃ vyuṣṭiṃ vyaśnute' kauṣī / /
analyzed: sā yā brahmaṇaḥ jitiḥ yā vyuṣṭiḥ tām jitim jayati tām vyuṣṭim vyaśnute kauṣī
translated: 'That is the victory of Brahman, that is the prosperity. He wins that victory, he enjoys that prosperity.'

original: 'tadya evaitaṃ brahmalokaṃ brahmacaryeṇānuvindati' chā / / /
analyzed: tat yaḥ eva etam brahma lokam brahmacaryeṇa anuvindati chā
translated: 'He who finds this world of Brahman by celibacy'

original: iti ca tatra tatra tat eva ekaṃ phalaṃ brahmalokaprāptilakṣaṇaṃ pradarśyate /
analyzed: iti ca tatra tatra tat eva ekam phalam brahma loka prāpti lakṣaṇam pradarśyate
translated: Thus, in various places, the same one result, characterized by the attainment of the world of Brahman, is shown.

original: yat tu etaiḥ eva iti avadhāraṇam arcirādi āśrayaṇe na syāt iti /
analyzed: yat tu etaiḥ eva iti avadhāraṇam arcirādi āśrayaṇe na syāt iti
translated: But if the word 'by these alone' is a restrictive one, then it would not be applicable if the path of light etc. were accepted.

original: na eṣa doṣaḥ /
analyzed: na eṣa doṣaḥ
translated: This is not a fault.

original: raśmiprāptiparatvāt asya /
analyzed: raśmi prāpti paratvāt asya
translated: Because this passage is concerned with reaching the rays.

original: na hi eka eva śabdo raśmīn ca prāpayitum arhati arcirādīn ca vyāvartayitum /
analyzed: na hi ekaḥ eva śabdaḥ raśmīn ca prāpayitum arhati arciḥ ādīn ca vyāvartayitum
translated: For one word cannot both make the rays be reached and make the light etc. be turned away.

original: tasmāt raśmisaṃbandha eva ayamavadhāryata iti draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: tasmāt raśmi saṃbandhaḥ eva ayam avadhāryate iti draṣṭavyam
translated: Therefore, it should be seen that this passage only determines the connection with the rays.

original: tvarāvacanaṃ tu arcirādi apekṣāyām api gantavyāntarāpekṣā śaighryārthatvāt na uparudhyate /
analyzed: tvarā vacanam tu arciḥ ādi apekṣāyām api gantavya antara apekṣā śaighrya artha tvāt na uparudhyate
translated: But the statement about haste is not obstructed by the need for light etc., because it is for the sake of speed in the need for another place to go,

original: yathā nimiṣamātreṇa atra āgamyata iti /
analyzed: yathā nimiṣa mātreṇa atra āgamyate iti
translated: as in 'He came here in just a moment.'

original: api ca 'athaitayoḥ pathornakatareṇācana' chā / /
analyzed: api ca atha etayoḥ pathoḥ na katareṇa acana chā
translated: Moreover, in the passage 'By which of these two paths?'

original: iti mārgadvayabhraṣṭānāṃ kaṣṭaṃ tṛtīyaṃ sthānam ācakṣāṇā pitṛyāṇavyatiriktam ekameva devayānam arcirādiparvāṇaṃ panthānaṃ prathayati /
analyzed: iti mārga dvaya bhraṣṭānām kaṣṭam tṛtīyam sthānam ācakṣāṇā pitṛyāṇa vyatiriktam ekam eva deva yānam arciḥ ādi parvāṇam panthānam prathayati
translated: it declares a third place of suffering for those who have fallen from both paths, and thus proclaims the path of the gods, which has the stages of light etc., as the only path apart from the path of the fathers.

original: bhūyāṃsi arcirādisṛtau mārgaparvāṇi alpīyāṃsi tu anyatra /
analyzed: bhūyāṃsi arciḥ ādi sṛtau mārga parvāṇi alpīyāṃsi tu anyatra
translated: There are many stages of the path in the journey of light etc., but few in the other.

original: bhūyasāṃ ca anuguṇyena alpīyasāṃ nayanaṃ nyāyyam iti ataḥ api arcirādinā tat prathiteḥ iti uktam // //
