analyzed: bhūyasām ca anuguṇyena alpīyasām nayanam nyāyyam iti atas api arciḥ ādinā tat prathiteḥ iti uktam  /
translated: And it is proper to bring the smaller number into conformity with the larger number. Therefore it is said that it is by the path of light etc., because that is well-known.

original: vāyu adhikaraṇam / sū /
analyzed: vāyu adhikaraṇam sū
translated: The section on Vayu.

original: vāyum abdād aviśeṣaviśeṣābhyām / / / /
analyzed: vāyum abdāt aviśeṣa viśeṣābhyām
translated: Vayu, from the year, by the general and specific.

original: kena punaḥ saṃniveśaviśeṣeṇa gativiśeṣāṇānām itaretara viśeṣaṇaviśeṣyabhāva iti tat etat suhṛt bhūtvā ācāryo grathayati /
analyzed: kena punar saṃniveśa viśeṣeṇa gati viśeṣāṇānām itaretara viśeṣaṇa viśeṣya bhāvaḥ iti tat etat suhṛd bhūtvā ācāryaḥ grathayati
translated: But by what particular arrangement of the special paths is there the relation of qualifier and qualified between them? The teacher, being a well-wisher, strings them together.

original: 'sa etaṃ devayānaṃ panthānamāpadyāgnilokamāgacchati sa vāyulokaṃ sa indralokaṃ sa prajāpatilokaṃ sa brahmalokam'kau / /
analyzed: saḥ etam deva yānam panthānam āpadya agni lokam āgacchati sa vāyu lokam saḥ indra lokam sa prajāpati lokam sa brahma lokamkau
translated: He, having entered this path of the gods, goes to the world of Agni, he to the world of Vayu, he to the world of Indra, he to the world of Prajapati, he to the world of Brahman. (Kau.Up. 1.2-3)

original: iti kauṣītakīnāṃ devayānaḥ panthāḥ paṭhyate /
analyzed: iti kauṣītakīnām deva yānaḥ panthāḥ paṭhyate
translated: This path of the gods of the Koushikitas is recited.

original: tatra arciḥ agnilokaśabdau tāvat ekārthau jvalanavacanatvāt iti na atra saṃniveśakramaḥ kvacit anveṣyaḥ /
analyzed: tatra arciḥ agni loka śabdau tāvat ekārthau jvalana vacana tvāt iti na atra saṃniveśa kramaḥ kvacid anveṣyaḥ
translated: There, the words light and world of Agni are synonymous, because they denote burning. Therefore, the sequence of arrangement should not be sought here anywhere.

original: vāyuḥ tu arcirādau vartmani na śrutaḥ katam asmin sthāne niveśayitavya iti /
analyzed: vāyuḥ tu arciḥ ādau vartmani na śrutaḥ asmin sthāne niveśayitavyaḥ iti
translated: But Vayu is not mentioned in the path beginning with light. In which place should it be inserted?

original: ucyate 'te 'rciṣamevābhisaṃbhavantyarciṣo 'harahna āpūryamāṇapakṣamāpūryamāṇapakṣādyānṣaḍudaṅṅeti māṃsāstān māsebhyaḥsaṃvatsaraṃ saṃvatsarādityam' 🔽chā / / / /
analyzed: ucyate te rciṣam eva abhisaṃbhavanti arciṣaḥ harahnaḥ āpūryamāṇapakṣam āpūryamāṇapakṣāt yān ṣaṭ udaṅ ā iti māṃsāḥ tān māsebhyaḥ saṃvatsaram saṃvatsara ādityam  / chā
translated: It is said: They enter the light, from the light into the day, from the day into the waxing fortnight, from the waxing fortnight into the months, from the months into the year, from the year into the sun.

original: iti atra saṃvatsarāt parāñcam ādityāt arvāñcaṃ vāyum abhisaṃbhavanti /
analyzed: iti atra saṃvatsarāt parāñcam ādityāt arvāñcam vāyum abhisaṃbhavanti
translated: Here, from the year they enter the wind, which is beyond the sun and below.

original: kasmāt /
analyzed: kasmāt
translated: Why?

original: aviśeṣaviśeṣābhyām /🔽tathā hi 'sa vāyulokam 'kau / /🔽iti atrāviśeṣa upadiṣṭasya vāyoḥ śrutyantare viśeṣa upadośo dṛśyate 'yadā vai puruṣo
analyzed: aviśeṣa viśeṣābhyām  tathā hi sa vāyulokam kau  iti atra aviśeṣaḥ upadiṣṭasya vāyoḥ śruti antare viśeṣaḥ upadośaḥ dṛśyate yadā vai
translated: Because of non-distinction and distinction.

original: 'smāllokātpraiti sa vāyumāgacchati tasmai sa tatra vijihīte yathā rathacakrasya khaṃ
analyzed: smāt lokāt praiti sa vāyum āgacchati tasmai sa tatra vijihīte yathā ratha cakrasya kham
translated: For thus, where the wind is taught without distinction, in another Vedic text a distinction is seen: When a person departs from this world, he goes to the wind. There he is woven like a hole in a chariot wheel.

original: tena sa ūrdhvamākramate sa ādityamāgacchati' bṛ / / iti /
analyzed: tena saḥ ūrdhvam ākramate saḥ ādityam āgacchati bṛ iti
translated: By that he ascends upwards. He goes to the sun.

original: etasmāt ādityāt vāyoḥ pūrvatvadarśanāt viśeṣāt abda ādityayoḥ antarāle vāyuḥ niveśayitavyaḥ /
analyzed: etasmāt ādityāt vāyoḥ pūrva tva darśanāt viśeṣāt abda ādityayoḥ antarāle vāyuḥ niveśayitavyaḥ
translated: From this, because the wind is seen to be before the sun, by the distinction, the wind should be placed between the year and the sun.

original: kasmāt punaḥ agneḥ paratvadarśanāt viśeṣāt arciṣaḥ anantaraṃ vāyuḥ na niveśyate /
analyzed: kasmāt punar agneḥ para tva darśanāt viśeṣāt arciṣaḥ anantaram vāyuḥ na niveśyate
translated: But why is the wind not placed immediately after the light, because of the distinction that the wind is seen to be beyond the fire?

original: na eṣaḥ asti viśeṣa iti vadāmaḥ /
analyzed: na eṣaḥ asti viśeṣa iti vadāmaḥ
translated: We say that there is no such distinction.

original: nanu udāhṛtā śrutiḥ 'sa etaṃ devayānaṃ panthānamāpadyāgnilokamāgacchati sa vāyulokaṃ sa varuṇalokam' kauṣī / / iti /
analyzed: nanu udāhṛtā śrutiḥ saḥ etam deva yānam panthānam āpadya agni lokam āgacchati sa vāyu lokam sa varuṇa lokam kauṣī iti
translated: But the Vedic text has been quoted: 'Having entered this path of the gods, he goes to the world of Agni, to the world of Vayu, to the world of Varuna' (Kaush. Up. 1. 2).

original: ucyate kevala atra pāṭhaḥ paurvāparyeṇāvasthito na atra kramavacanaḥ /
analyzed: ucyate kevala atra pāṭhaḥ paurvāparyeṇa avasthitaḥ na atra krama vacanaḥ
translated: It is said: Here only the text is arranged in sequence, there is no word here that expresses sequence.

original: kaścit śabdaḥ asti /
analyzed: kaścid śabdaḥ asti
translated: There is no word that expresses sequence.

original: padārtha upadarśanamātraṃ hi atra kriyate etam etaṃ ca āgacchati iti itaratra punaḥ
analyzed: padārthaḥ upadarśana mātram hi atra kriyate etam etam ca āgacchati iti itaratra punar
translated: For here it is merely shown that he goes to this and that, while in the other text

original: vāyuprattena rathacakramātreṇa cchidreṇa ūrdhvam ākramya ādityam āgacchati iti avagamyate kramaḥ /
analyzed: vāyu prattena ratha cakra mātreṇa chidreṇa ūrdhvam ākramya ādityam āgacchati iti avagamyate kramaḥ
translated: it is understood that he goes upwards through a hole the size of a chariot wheel provided by Vayu, and reaches the sun.

original: tasmāt sūktam aviśeṣaviśeṣābhyām iti /🔽vājasaneyinaḥ tu 'māsebhyo devalokaṃ devalokādādityam' bṛ / / /
analyzed: tasmāt sūktam a viśeṣa viśeṣābhyām iti  vājasaneyinaḥ tu māsebhyaḥ deva lokam deva lokāt ādityam bṛ
translated: Therefore, it is rightly said that there is no distinction or sequence.

original: iti samāmananti /
analyzed: iti samāmananti
translated: But the followers of the Vājasaneyaka recite: 'From the months to the world of the gods, from the world of the gods to the sun' (Br. 3. 9. 11).

original: tatra ādityān antaryāya devalokāt vāyum abhisaṃbhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: tatra ādityān antaryāya deva lokāt vāyum abhisaṃbhaveyuḥ
translated: There, they may reach Vayu from the world of the gods after passing through the sun.

original: vāyum abdāt iti tu chandogaśruti apekṣayā uktam /
analyzed: vāyum abdāt iti tu chandogaśruti apekṣayā uktam
translated: But 'from the year to Vayu' is said with reference to the Chāndogya text.

original: chāndogya vājasaneyakayoḥ tu ekatra devaloko na vidyate paratra saṃvatsaraḥ /
analyzed: chāndogya vājasaneyakayoḥ tu ekatra deva lokaḥ na vidyate paratra saṃvatsaraḥ
translated: But in the Chāndogya and Vājasaneyaka, the world of the gods is not found in one, and the year in the other.

original: tatra śrutidvayapratyayāt ubhau api ubhayatra grathayitavyau /
analyzed: tatra śruti dvaya pratyayāt ubhau api ubhayatra grathayitavyau
translated: There, because of the authority of both Śrutis, both should be combined in both places.

original: tatra api māsasaṃbandhāt saṃvatsaraḥ pūrvaḥ paścimo devaloka iti vivektavyam // //
analyzed: tatra api māsa saṃbandhāt saṃvatsaraḥ pūrvaḥ paścimaḥ deva lokaḥ iti vivektavyam  /
translated: Even there, the year should be distinguished as the earlier, and the world of the gods as the later, because of the connection with the months.

original: taḍidadhikaraṇam / sū /
analyzed: taḍit adhikaraṇam sū
translated: The section on lightning. Sūtra.

original: taṭito 'dhi varuṇaḥ saṃbandhāt / / / /🔽'ādityāccandramasaṃ candramaso vidyutam' chā / / /
analyzed: taṭitaḥ dhi varuṇaḥ saṃbandhāt  / ādityāt candramasam candramasaḥ vidyutam chā
translated: Varuṇa is above lightning, because of the connection.

original: iti asyā vidyuta upariṣṭāt sa varuṇalokam iti ayaṃ varuṇaḥ saṃbadhyate /
analyzed: iti asyāḥ vidyutaḥ upariṣṭāt sa varuṇa lokam iti ayam varuṇaḥ saṃbadhyate
translated: From the sun to the moon, from the moon to lightning, (Chāndogya Upaniṣad 5.10.1) - this lightning is connected to this Varuṇa above, he goes to the world of Varuṇa.

original: asti hi saṃbandho vidyut varuṇayoḥ /
analyzed: asti hi saṃbandhaḥ vidyut varuṇayoḥ
translated: For there is a connection between lightning and Varuṇa.

original: yadā hi viśāla avidyutaḥ tīvraḥ tanitaniḥ ghoṣā jīmūta udareṣu pranṛtyanti āthāpaḥ prapatanti /🔽vidyotate stanayati 'varṣiṣyati vā' chā / / /
analyzed: yadā hi viśāla avidyutaḥ tīvraḥ tanitaniḥ ghoṣā jīmūta udareṣu pranṛtyanti āthāpaḥ prapatanti  vidyotate stanayati varṣiṣyati vā chā
translated: For when the vast lightning dances with a loud clap in the bellies of the clouds, then the rains fall.

original: iti ca brāhmaṇam /
analyzed: iti ca brāhmaṇam
translated: And in the Brāhmaṇa it is said, It flashes, it thunders, it will rain.

original: apāṃ ca adhipatiḥ varuṇa iti śrutismṛtiprasiddhiḥ /
analyzed: apām ca adhipatiḥ varuṇaḥ iti śruti smṛti prasiddhiḥ
translated: And it is well known in Śruti and Smṛti that Varuṇa is the lord of the waters.

original: varuṇāt adhīndraprajāpatī sthānāntara abhāvāt pāṭhasāmarthyāt ca /
analyzed: varuṇāt adhi indra prajāpatī sthāna antara abhāvāt pāṭha sāmarthyāt ca
translated: From Varuṇa to Indra and Prajāpati, because there is no difference in place, and because of the force of the text.

original: ānantukatvāt api varuṇādīnām anta eva niveśo vaiśeṣikasthānābhāvāt vidyut ca antya arcirādau vartmani // //
analyzed: ānantuka tvāt api varuṇa ādīnām ante eva niveśaḥ vaiśeṣika sthāna abhāvāt vidyut ca antya arcis ādau vartmani  /
translated: And because of their endlessness, Varuṇa and the others are placed at the end, because there is no special place, and lightning is in the path of the end of the light etc.

original: ātivāhika adhikaraṇam / sū / 🔽ātivāhikās talliṅgāt / / / /
analyzed: ātivāhika adhikaraṇam sū  ātivāhikāḥ tad liṅgāt  /
translated: The section on the path-guiding. Sutra.🔽The path-guiding ones, because of the indication of that.

original: teṣu eva arcirādiṣu saṃśayaḥ kim etāni mārgacihnāni uta bhogabhūmayaḥ athavā netāro gantṛṇām iti /
analyzed: teṣu eva arciḥ ādiṣu saṃśayaḥ kim etāni mārga cihnāni uta bhogabhūmayaḥ athavā netāraḥ gantṛṇām iti
translated: There is doubt regarding those same light etc. - are these the signs of the path, or the places of enjoyment, or the guides of the travelers?

original: tatra mārgalakṣaṇabhūtā arcirādaya iti tāvat prāptam /
analyzed: tatra mārga lakṣaṇa bhūtāḥ arciḥ ādayaḥ iti tāvat prāptam
translated: Regarding that, it is first concluded that the light etc. are the characteristics of the path.

original: tatsvarūpatvāt upadeśasya /
analyzed: tad svarūpa tvāt upadeśasya
translated: Because the teaching has their nature.

original: yathā hi loke kaścit grāmaṃ nagaraṃ vā pratiṣṭhāsamānaḥ anuśiṣyate gacchetaḥ tvam
analyzed: yathā hi loke kaścid grāmam nagaram vā pratiṣṭhā samānaḥ anuśiṣyate gaccha itas tvam
translated: For just as in the world someone setting out for a village or city is instructed: You should go from here,

original: amuṃ giriṃ tato nyagrodhaṃ tato nadīṃ tato grāmaṃ tato nagaraṃ vā prāpsyasi iti evam
analyzed: amum girim tatas nyagrodham tatas nadīm tatas grāmam tatas nagaram vā prāpsyasi iti evam
translated: to that mountain, then to the banyan tree, then to the river, then to the village, then you will reach the city,

original: iha api arciṣo aharahna āpūryamāṇapakṣim ityādi āha /
analyzed: iha api arciṣaḥ ahar ahnaḥ āpūryamāṇapakṣim ityādi āha
translated: in the same way here also it is said: from the light to the day, from the day to the waxing fortnight, and so on.

original: athavā bhogabhūmaya iti prāptam /
analyzed: athavā bhogabhūmayaḥ iti prāptam
translated: Or it is concluded that they are the places of enjoyment.

original: tathā hi 'lokaśabdenāgnyādīnanubadhnāti agnilokamāgacchati' kauṣī / / ityādi /
analyzed: tathā hi loka śabdena agni ādīn anubadhnāti agni lokam āgacchati kauṣī ityādi
translated: For thus, in the passage, ‘He goes to the world of Agni,’ Kausītaki, the word ‘world’ is applied to Agni and the rest.

original: lokaśabdaḥ ca prāṇināṃ bhogāyataneṣu bhāṣyate 'manuṣyalokaḥ pitṛloko devalokaḥ' bṛ / / / iti ca /
analyzed: loka śabdaḥ ca prāṇinām bhogāyataneṣu bhāṣyate manuṣya lokaḥ pitṛ lokaḥ deva lokaḥ iti ca
translated: And the word ‘world’ is used for the abodes of enjoyment of living beings, as in the passage, ‘The world of men, the world of the manes, the world of the gods,’ Bṛhadā.

original: tathā ca brāhmaṇam 'ahorātreṣu te lokeṣu sajjante' ityādi /
analyzed: tathā ca brāhmaṇam ahar rātreṣu te lokeṣu sajjante ityādi
translated: And thus the Brāhmaṇa (says), ‘In those worlds of day and night they are born,’ and so on.

original: tasmāt na ativāhikā arcirādayaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt na ativāhikāḥ arciḥ ādayaḥ
translated: Therefore, the light and the rest are not conveyers.

original: acetanatvāt api eteṣām ativāhikatva anupapattiḥ /
analyzed: acetana tvāt api eteṣām ativāhika tva anupapattiḥ
translated: And on account of their being non-intelligent, the conveyance by them is not possible.

original: cetanā hi loke rājaniyuktāḥ puruṣā durgeṣu mārgeṣu ativāhyān ativāhayanti iti /
analyzed: cetanāḥ hi loke rāja niyuktāḥ puruṣāḥ durgeṣu mārgeṣu ativāhyān ativāhayanti iti
translated: For, in the world, intelligent men appointed by the king convey travellers on difficult roads.

original: evaṃ prāpte brūmaḥ ātivāhikā eva ete bhavitum arhanti /
analyzed: evam prāpte brūmaḥ ātivāhikāḥ eva ete bhavitum arhanti
translated: When this is the case, we say that they must be conveyers.

original: kutaḥ talliṅgāt /
analyzed: kutas tad liṅgāt
translated: Why? Because of the indication of that.

original: tathā hi 'candramaso vidyutaṃ tatpuruṣo 'mānavaḥ sa etānbrahma gamayati' chā / / /
analyzed: tathā hi candramasaḥ vidyutam tad puruṣaḥ mānavaḥ saḥ etān brahma gamayati chā
translated: For thus, in the passage, ‘From the moon to the lightning, that is the superhuman person. He conveys them to Brahman,’ Chānd.,

original: iti siddhat gamayitṛtvaṃ darśayati /
analyzed: iti gamayitṛ tvam darśayati
translated: it shows the state of being a conveyor as established.

original: tat vacanaṃ tat viṣayam eva upakṣīṇam iti cet / na /
analyzed: tat vacanam tad viṣayam eva upakṣīṇam iti ced na
translated: If it be said that that statement is exhausted in that very subject, no.

original: prāptamānavatva nivṛttiparatvāt viśeṣaṇasya /
analyzed: prāptamānavatva nivṛtti paratvāt viśeṣaṇasya
translated: Because the qualification is for the purpose of removing the attainment of humanity.

original: yadi arcirādiṣu puruṣā gamayitāraḥ prāptāḥ te ca mānavāḥ tato yuktaṃ tat nivṛttyarthaṃ puruṣaviśeṣaṇam amānava iti // //
analyzed: yadi arciḥ ādiṣu puruṣāḥ gamayitāraḥ prāptāḥ te ca mānavāḥ tatas yuktam tat nivṛtti artham puruṣa viśeṣaṇam amānavaḥ iti  /
translated: If the persons who convey them to the other world are attained in the light etc., and they are human, then it is proper to specify a particular person as non-human in order to exclude them.

original: nanu talliṅgamātram agamakaṃ nyāya abhāvāt /
analyzed: nanu tat liṅga mātram agamakam nyāyaḥ abhāvāt
translated: But that mere indication is not a proof, because there is no reasoning.

original: na eṣa doṣaḥ /
analyzed: na eṣa doṣaḥ
translated: This is not a fault.

original: ubhayavyāmohāt tat siddheḥ / / / /
analyzed: ubhaya vyāmohāt tad siddheḥ
translated: Because it is established from the delusion of both.

original: ye tāvat arcirādimārgāḥ te dehaviyogāt saṃpiṇḍitakaraṇagrāmā iti asvatantrā arcirādīnām🔽api acetanatvāt asvātantryam iti ataḥ arcirādi abhimāninaḥ cetanā devatāviśeṣā atiyātrāyāṃ
analyzed: ye tāvat arciḥ ādi mārgāḥ te deha viyogāt saṃpiṇḍita karaṇa grāmāḥ iti asvatantrāḥ arciḥ ādīnām  api acetana tvāt asvātantryam iti atas arciḥ ādi abhimāninaḥ cetanā devatā viśeṣāḥ atiyātrāyām
translated: Those who follow the path of light etc. are not independent because they are separated from the body and have their senses combined.

original: niyuktā iti gamyate /
analyzed: niyuktāḥ iti gamyate
translated: And because of insentience, the light etc. are also not independent. Therefore, it is understood that the deities, who are the presiding deities of the light etc., are appointed to lead them.

original: loke api hi matta mūrcchitādayaḥ saṃpiṇḍitakaraṇāḥ paraprayuktavartmāno bhavanti /
analyzed: loke api hi matta mūrcchita ādayaḥ saṃpiṇḍita karaṇāḥ para prayukta vartmānaḥ bhavanti
translated: Even in the world, those whose senses are combined, like the intoxicated and the unconscious, have their path employed by others.

original: anavasthitatvāt api arcirādīnāṃ na mārgalakṣaṇatva upapattiḥ /
analyzed: anavasthita tvāt api arciḥ ādīnām na mārga lakṣaṇa tve upapattiḥ
translated: And because of instability, the light etc. are not logically characterized as a path.

original: na hi rātrau pretasya ahaḥsvarūpa abhisaṃbhava upapadyate /
analyzed: na hi rātrau pretasya ahaḥsvarūpa abhisaṃbhava upapadyate
translated: For it is not possible for a dead person to attain the form of the day at night.

original: na ca pratipālanamasti iti uktaṃ purastāt /
analyzed: na ca pratipālanam asti iti uktam purastāt
translated: And it has been said before that there is no waiting.

original: dhruvatvāt tu devatā ātmānāṃ na ayaṃ doṣo bhavati /
analyzed: dhruva tvāt tu devatā ātmānām na ayam doṣaḥ bhavati
translated: But this fault does not arise for the gods, because their nature is fixed.

original: arcirādi śabdatā ca eṣām arcirādi abhimānāt upapadyate 'arciṣo 'haḥ'chā / / / / / /
analyzed: arciḥ ādi śabda tā ca eṣām arciḥ ādi abhimānāt upapadyate arciṣaḥ haḥchā
translated: And their being called light etc. is justified by their identification with light etc., as stated in From light, the day and so on.

original: ityādinirdeśaḥ tu ativāhikatve api na virudhyate arciṣā hetunā ahaḥ abhisaṃbhavati /
analyzed: ityādinirdeśaḥ tu ativāhika tve api na virudhyate arciṣā hetunā ahar abhisaṃbhavati
translated: As for the statement beginning with From light, the day, it is not contradicted even in the case of being conveyors, since the day is attained by the light as a cause.

original: ahnā hetunā āpūryamāṇapakṣam iti /
analyzed: ahnā hetunā āpūryamāṇapakṣam iti
translated: By the day as a cause, the waxing fortnight is attained.

original: tathā ca loke prasiddheṣu api ativāhikeṣu evañjātīyaka upadeśo dṛśyate /
analyzed: tathā ca loke prasiddheṣu api ativāhikeṣu evañjātīyakaḥ upadeśaḥ dṛśyate
translated: And such instruction is seen even in well-known conveyances in the world.

original: gaccha tvam ito balavarmāṇaṃ tato jayasiṃhaṃ tataḥ kṛṣṇaguptam iti /
analyzed: gaccha tvam itas balavarmāṇam tatas jayasiṃham tatas kṛṣṇaguptam iti
translated: Go from here to Balavarma, from there to Jayasimha, from there to Krishnagupta.

original: api ca upakrame 'te 'rcirabhisaṃbhavanti' bṛ / / /
analyzed: api ca upakrame te rciḥ abhisaṃbhavanti bṛ
translated: Moreover, at the beginning, it is said that They attain the light (Br. 3.2.11),

original: iti saṃbandhamātramuktaṃ na saṃbandhaviśeṣaḥ kaścit /
analyzed: iti saṃbandha mātram uktam na saṃbandha viśeṣaḥ kaścid
translated: only the mere connection is stated, not any particular connection.

original: upasaṃhāre tu 'sa etānbrahma gamayati chā / / /
analyzed: upasaṃhāre tu saḥ etān brahma gamayati chā
translated: But in the conclusion, He leads them to Brahman (Br. 3.2.11),

original: iti saṃbandhaviśeṣaḥ ativāhi ativāhakatva lakṣaṇa uktaḥ tena sa eva upakrame api iti nirdhāryate /
analyzed: iti saṃbandha viśeṣaḥ ativāhi ativāhaka tva lakṣaṇa uktaḥ tena saḥ eva upakrame api iti nirdhāryate
translated: a particular connection characterized by conveying and being conveyed is stated. Therefore, that alone is determined even at the beginning.

original: saṃpiṇḍitakaraṇatvāt eva ca gantṛṣu na tatra upabhogasaṃbhavaḥ /
analyzed: saṃpiṇḍita karaṇa tvāt eva ca gantṛṣu na tatra upabhoga saṃbhavaḥ
translated: And because of the combination of the goers, there is no possibility of enjoyment there.

original: lokaśabdaḥ tu anupabhuñjāneṣu api gantṛṣu gamayituṃ śakyate /
analyzed: loka śabdaḥ tu an upabhuñjāneṣu api gantṛṣu gamayitum śakyate
translated: But the word 'world' can be applied to those who are not enjoying, to those who are going.

original: anyeṣāṃ tat lokavāsināṃ bhogabhūmitvāt /
analyzed: anyeṣām tat loka vāsinām bhogabhūmi tvāt
translated: Because it is the place of enjoyment for others who dwell in that world.

original: ataḥ agnisvāmikaṃ lokaṃ prāptaḥ agninā ativāhyate vāyusvāmikaṃ prāpto vāyunā iti yojayitavyam // //
analyzed: atas agni svāmikam lokam prāptaḥ agninā ativāhyate vāyu svāmikam prāptaḥ vāyunā iti yojayitavyam  /
translated: Therefore, one who has attained the world owned by Agni is carried across by Agni, and one who has attained the world owned by Vayu is carried across by Vayu - this is how it should be connected.

original: kathaṃ punaḥ ativāhikatvapakṣe varuṇādiṣu tatsaṃbhavaḥ /
analyzed: katham punar ativāhika tva pakṣe varuṇa ādiṣu tad saṃbhavaḥ
translated: But how is it possible for Varuṇa and others in the view that they carry across?

original: vidyuto hi adhi varuṇādaya upakṣiptā vidyutaḥ tu anantaramā brahmaprāpteḥ amānavasya eva puruṣasya gamayitṛtvaṃ śrutam iti /
analyzed: vidyutaḥ hi adhi varuṇa ādayaḥ upakṣiptāḥ vidyutaḥ tu anantaramāḥ brahma prāpteḥ amānavasya eva puruṣasya gamayitṛ tvam śrutam iti
translated: For Varuṇa and the others are placed above the lightning, but the carrying across to the world of Brahman immediately after the lightning is stated to be done by a non-human person.

original: ata uttaraṃ paṭhati
analyzed: atas uttaram paṭhati
translated: Therefore, he replies to this:

original: vaidyutenaiva tatas tacchruteḥ / / / /
analyzed: vaidyutena eva tatas tad śruteḥ  /
translated: Because of the statement about it by the one from the lightning.

original: tato vidyut abhisaṃbhavanāt ūrdhvaṃ vidyut anantaravartina eva amānavena puruṣeṇa varuṇalokādiṣu ativāhyamānā brahmalokaṃ gacchanti iti avagantavyam
analyzed: tatas vidyut abhisaṃbhavanāt ūrdhvam vidyut anantara vartinaḥ eva amānavena puruṣeṇa varuṇa loka ādiṣu ativāhyamānāḥ brahma lokam gacchanti iti avagantavyam
translated: After the attainment of the lightning, it should be understood that those who are carried across in the worlds of Varuṇa and so on by the very non-human person who is immediately after the lightning go to the world of Brahman.

original: 'tānvaidyutātpuruṣo 'mānavaḥ sa etya brahmalokaṃ gamayati' iti tasya eva gamayitṛtvaśruteḥ /
analyzed: tān vaidyutāt puruṣaḥ mānavaḥ saḥ etya brahma lokam gamayati iti tasya eva gamayitṛ tva śruteḥ
translated: Because of the statement that he alone is the one who carries them across, 'The non-human person from the lightning comes and carries them to the world of Brahman.'

original: varuṇādayaḥ tu tasya eva apratibandhakaraṇena sāhāyya anuṣṭhānena vā kenacit anugrāhakā iti avagantavyam /
analyzed: varuṇa ādayaḥ tu tasya eva apratibandha karaṇena sāhāyya anuṣṭhānena vā kenacid anugrāhakā iti avagantavyam
translated: But it must be understood that Varuṇa and the other gods assist him by removing obstacles and by rendering him other services.

original: tasmāt sādhu uktam ativāhikā devatātmānaḥ arcirādaya iti // //
analyzed: tasmāt sādhu uktam ativāhikāḥ devatā ātmānaḥ arciḥ ādayaḥ iti  /
translated: Therefore it has been well said that the Selfs of the gods, such as light and so on, are conveyers.

original: kārya adhikaraṇam / sū /
analyzed: kārya adhikaraṇam sū
translated: The section on the effect. Sūtra

original: kāryaṃ bādarirasya gatyupapatteḥ / / / /
analyzed: kāryam bādariḥ asya gati upapatteḥ
translated: The effect, because of the possibility of going to it, according to Bādarāyaṇa.

original: 'sa enānbrahma gamayati chā / / /
analyzed: saḥ enān brahma gamayati chā
translated: He leads them to Brahman.

original: iti atra vicikitsyate kiṃ kāryam aparaṃ brahma gamayati āhosvit param eva avikṛtaṃ mukhyaṃ brahma iti /
analyzed: iti atra vicikitsyate  kim kāryam aparam brahma gamayati āhosvit param eva avikṛtam mukhyam brahma iti
translated: Here there is doubt: Does he lead them to an effect, a different Brahman, or to the supreme, unmodified, principal Brahman?

original: kutaḥ saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: kutas saṃśayaḥ
translated: Why is there doubt?

original: brahmaśabdaprayogāt gatiśruteḥ ca /
analyzed: brahma śabda prayogāt gati śruteḥ ca
translated: Because the word Brahman is used and because of the mention of going.

original: tatra kāryameva saguṇam aparaṃ brahma enān gamayati amānavaḥ puruṣa iti bādariḥ ācāryo manyate /
analyzed: tatra kāryam eva sa guṇam aparam brahma enān gamayati amānavaḥ puruṣaḥ iti bādariḥ ācāryaḥ manyate
translated: There, Bādarāyaṇa, the teacher, thinks that the nonhuman person leads them to the effect, the Brahman with qualities, which is different.

original: kutaḥ asya gati upapatteḥ /🔽asya hi kāryabrahmaṇo gantavyatvam upapatteḥ /
analyzed: kutas asya gati upapatteḥ  asya hi kārya brahmaṇaḥ gantavya tvam upapatteḥ
translated: Because of the possibility of going to it.🔽For this Brahman, which is an effect, it is possible to go to it.

original: asya hi kāryabrahmaṇo gantavyatvam upapadyate pradeśavattvāt /
analyzed: asya hi kārya brahmaṇaḥ gantavya tvam upapadyate pradeśavat tvāt
translated: For this Brahman, which is an effect, it is possible to go to it, because it has parts.

original: na tu parasmin brahmaṇi gantṛtvaṃ gantavyatvaṃ gatiḥ vā avakalpate /
analyzed: na tu parasmin brahmaṇi gantṛ tvam gantavya tvam gatiḥ vā avakalpate
translated: But as regards the highest Brahman, neither the state of being a goer, nor that of being a place to be gone to, nor the act of going, is possible.

original: sarvagatatvāt pratyagātmatvāt ca gantṛṇām // //
analyzed: sarvagata tvāt pratyagātma tvāt ca gantṛṇām
translated: For the goers are all-pervading, and the highest Brahman is the Self of all.

original: viśeṣitatvāc ca / / / /🔽brahmalokāngamayati te teṣu brahmalokeṣu parāḥ parāvato vasanti' bṛ / / /
analyzed: viśeṣita tvāt ca  brahma lokān gamayati te teṣu brahma lokeṣu parāḥ parāvataḥ vasanti bṛ
translated: And because it is qualified.

original: iti ca śrutyantare viśeṣitatvāt kāryabrahmaviṣaya eva gatiḥ iti gamyate /
analyzed: iti ca śruti antare viśeṣita tvāt kārya brahma viṣayaḥ eva gatiḥ iti gamyate
translated: For in another scriptural passage Brahman is qualified, It leads them to the world of Brahman, and in those worlds of Brahman they dwell as the highest, beyond the highest Bṛ Up , , 0; from which it appears that the going spoken of there refers to the effected Brahman only.

original: nahi bahuvacanena viśeṣaṇaṃ parasmin brahmaṇi avakalpate /
analyzed: nahi bahuvacanena viśeṣaṇam parasmin brahmaṇi avakalpate
translated: For the qualification by the plural number is not possible with regard to the highest Brahman.

original: kārye tu avasthābheda upapatteḥ saṃbhavati bahuvacanam /
analyzed: kārye tu avasthā bhedaḥ upapatteḥ saṃbhavati bahuvacanam
translated: But in the case of the effected Brahman it is possible, because there is a difference of states.

original: lokaśrutiḥ api vikāragocarāyāma eva saṃniveśaviśiṣṭāyāṃ bhogabhūmāvau āñjasī /🔽gauṇī tu anyatra 'brahmaiva loka eṣa samrāṭ' ityādiṣu /
analyzed: loka śrutiḥ api vikāra gocarāyām eva saṃniveśa viśiṣṭāyām bhogabhūmau au āñjasī  gauṇī tu anyatra brahmā eva lokaḥ eṣa samrāj ityādiṣu
translated: The word world, moreover, is appropriate only in the case of a place of enjoyment, which is the sphere of modifications, and is distinguished by a certain arrangement.🔽In other passages, on the other hand, it is used in a secondary sense; cp eg the passage, Brahman is the world, the emperor Bṛ Up , , 0

original: adhikaraṇa adhikartavyanirdeśaḥ api parasmin brahmaṇi anāñjasaḥ syāt /
analyzed: adhikaraṇa adhikartavya nirdeśaḥ api parasmin brahmaṇi anāñjasaḥ syāt
translated: The direction to go and to be done which is given with regard to the highest Brahman would be inappropriate.

original: tasmāt kāryaviṣayameva idaṃ nayanam // //
analyzed: tasmāt kārya viṣayam eva idam nayanam
translated: Therefore the going spoken of in the passage under discussion refers to the effected Brahman only

original: nanu kāryaviṣaye api brahmaśabdo na upapadyate samanvaye hi samastasya jagato janmādikāraṇaṃ sthāpitam iti /
analyzed: nanu kārya viṣaye api brahma śabdaḥ na upapadyate samanvaye hi samastasya jagataḥ janma ādikāraṇam sthāpitam iti
translated: But even in the case of the effect, the word Brahman is not appropriate, for in the context it has been established that Brahman is the cause of the origin, etc. of the entire world.

original: atra ucyate
analyzed: atra ucyate
translated: To this it is said:

original: sāmīpyāt tu tadvyapadeśaḥ / / / /
analyzed: sāmīpyāt tu tad vyapadeśaḥ
translated: But the designation of Brahman is due to proximity.

original: tu śabda āśaṅkā vyāvṛttyarthaḥ /
analyzed: tu śabdaḥ āśaṅkā vyāvṛtti arthaḥ
translated: The word tu (but) is for the purpose of setting aside doubt.

original: parabrahmasāmīpyāt aparasya brahmaṇaḥ tasmin api brahmaśabdaprayogo na virudhyate /
analyzed: para brahma sāmīpyāt aparasya brahmaṇaḥ tasmin api brahma śabda prayogaḥ na virudhyate
translated: The application of the word Brahman to the lower Brahman is not contradictory, due to proximity to the supreme Brahman.

original: param eva hi brahma viśuddha upādhisaṃbandhaṃ kvacit kaiścit vikāradharmaiḥ manomayatvādibhiḥ upāsanāya upadiśyamānam aparam iti sthitiḥ //
analyzed: param eva hi brahma viśuddha upādhi saṃbandham kvacid kaiścid vikāra dharmaiḥ manaḥ maya tva ādibhiḥ upāsanāya upadiśyamānam aparam iti sthitiḥ
translated: For the supreme Brahman itself, free from the connection with limiting adjuncts, is sometimes taught by some as the lower Brahman, for the purpose of meditation, by means of attributes such as being made of mind, etc. This is the position.

original: nanu kāryaprāptau anāvṛttiśravaṇaṃ na ghaṭate /
analyzed: nanu kārya prāptau anāvṛtti śravaṇam na ghaṭate
translated: But if the effect is attained, the statement of non-return does not hold.

original: na hi parasmāt brahmaṇaḥ anyatra kvacit nityatāṃ saṃbhāvayanti /
analyzed: na hi parasmāt brahmaṇaḥ anyatra kvacid nitya tām saṃbhāvayanti
translated: For they do not imagine eternality anywhere else than the supreme Brahman.

original: darśayati ca devayānena pathā prasthitānām anāvṛttim /
analyzed: darśayati ca deva yānena pathā prasthitānām anāvṛttim
translated: And it shows non-return of those who have set out by the path of the gods.

original: 'etena pratipadyamānā imaṃ mānavamāvartaṃ nāvartante' chā / / /
analyzed: etena pratipadyamānāḥ imam mānavam āvartam na āvartante chā
translated: Those who proceed by this do not return to this human cycle.

original: iti teṣām iha na punarāvṛttiḥ asti 'tayordhvamāyannamṛtatvameti' chā / / / / ka / / iti cet /
analyzed: iti teṣām iha na punarāvṛttiḥ asti tayā ūrdhvam āyan amṛta tvam eti chā kaḥ iti ced
translated: Thus, for them there is no return here. 'Having gone upwards, he attains immortality' (Ch. U. 8.15.1). If this is argued,

original: atra brūmaḥ
analyzed: atra brūmaḥ
translated: we say:

original: kāryātyaye tadadhyakṣeṇa sahātaḥ param abhidhānāt / / / /🔽kāryabrahmalokapralayapratyupasthāne sati tatra eva utpannasamyagdarśanāḥ santaḥ tat adhyakṣeṇa hiraṇyagarbheṇa sahātaḥ paraṃ pariśuddhaṃ viṣṇoḥ
analyzed: kārya atyaye tad adhyakṣeṇa saha atas param abhidhānāt  kārya brahma loka pralaya pratyupasthāne sati tatra eva utpanna samyak darśanāḥ santaḥ tat adhyakṣeṇa hiraṇyagarbheṇa saha atas param pariśuddham viṣṇoḥ  /
translated: After the dissolution of the effect, along with the overseer of that, because it is mentioned beyond that.

original: paramaṃ padaṃ pratipadyanta iti /
analyzed: paramam padam pratipadyante iti
translated: When the dissolution of the effect, the world of Brahman, is imminent, those who have attained perfect knowledge there, along with the overseer, Hiranyagarbha, attain the supreme abode of Vishnu, which is pure beyond that.

original: kramamuktiḥ anāvṛttyādi śruti abhidhānebhyo abhyupagantavyā /
analyzed: kramamuktiḥ anāvṛtti ādi śruti abhidhānebhyaḥ abhyupagantavyā
translated: The gradual liberation, the non-return, etc., should be accepted on the basis of the Vedic statements and declarations.

original: na hi āñjasa eva gatipūrvikā paraprāptiḥ saṃbhavati iti upapaditam // //
analyzed: na hi āñjasaḥ eva gati pūrvikā paraprāptiḥ saṃbhavati iti upapaditam  /
translated: For it has been argued that the attainment of the supreme by the lower is not possible through a path that is direct.

original: smṛteś ca / / / /
analyzed: smṛteḥ ca
translated: And also because of the Smriti.

original: smṛtiḥ api etam artham anujānāti 'brahmaṇā saha te sarve saṃprāpte pratisaṃcare /
analyzed: smṛtiḥ api etam artham anujānāti brahmaṇā saha te sarve saṃprāpte pratisaṃcare
translated: The Smriti also acknowledges this meaning: 'When the universal dissolution arrives, all of them, along with Brahman,

original: parasyānte kṛtātmānaḥ praviśanti paraṃ padam'iti /
analyzed: parasya ante kṛtātmānaḥ praviśanti param padam iti
translated: having their souls purified at the end of the supreme, enter the supreme abode' (Devi. P. 3.16.16).

original: tasmāt kāryabrahmaviṣayā gatiḥ śrūyata iti siddhāntaḥ // //
analyzed: tasmāt kārya brahma viṣayā gatiḥ śrūyate iti siddhāntaḥ
translated: Therefore, the conclusion is that the passage speaks of the progress towards the Brahman that is the effect.

original: kaṃ puna pūrvapakṣam āśaṅkya ayaṃ siddhāntaḥ pratiṣṭhāpitaḥ 'kāryaṃ bādariḥ' bra /sū / / /
analyzed: kam puna pūrvapakṣam āśaṅkya ayam siddhāntaḥ pratiṣṭhāpitaḥ kāryam bādariḥ brasū
translated: But what is the prima facie view, in regard to which this conclusion has been established? 'The effect, according to Bādarāyaṇa' (Sū. 1.1.5).

original: ityādina iti /
analyzed: ityādinaḥ iti
translated: Thus, etc.

original: sa idānīṃ sūtraiḥ eva upadarśyate
analyzed: sa idānīm sūtraiḥ eva upadarśyate
translated: Now that is shown by the aphorisms themselves.

original: paraṃ jaiminir mukhyatvāt / / / /🔽jaiminiḥ tu ācāryaḥ 'sa enānbrahma gamayati'chā / / /
analyzed: param jaiminiḥ mukhya tvāt  jaiminiḥ tu ācāryaḥ saḥ enān brahma gamayati ichā
translated: But Jaimini (holds) the highest (Self), on account of its being the principal one.

original: iti atra parameva brahma prāpayati iti manyate /
analyzed: iti atra param eva brahma prāpayati iti manyate
translated: But the teacher Jaimini thinks that in this passage, 'He leads them to Brahman' (Chānd. 8.15.1), he causes them to attain the highest Brahman itself.

original: kutaḥ mukhyatvāt /
analyzed: kutas mukhya tvāt
translated: Why? On account of its being the principal one.

original: paraṃ hi brahma brahmaśabdasya mukhyam ālambanaṃ /
analyzed: param hi brahma brahma śabdasya mukhyam ālambanam
translated: For the highest Brahman is the principal object of the word 'Brahman.'

original: gauṇam aparaṃ /
analyzed: gauṇam aparam
translated: The other is the secondary one.

original: mukhyagauṇayogaḥ ca mukhye saṃpratyayo bhavati // //
analyzed: mukhya gauṇa yogaḥ ca mukhye saṃpratyayaḥ bhavati  /
translated: And in the case of a connection with the principal and the secondary, the cognition is of the principal one.

original: darśanāc ca / / / /
analyzed: darśanāt ca
translated: And on account of the seeing.

original: 'tayordhvamāyannamṛtatvameti' chā / / / / ka / /
analyzed: tayā ūrdhvam āyan amṛta tvam eti chā  ka
translated: 'Going upwards from them, he attains immortality' (Chānd. 8.8.3).

original: iti ca gatipūrvakam amṛtatvaṃ darśayati /
analyzed: iti ca gati pūrvakam amṛta tvam darśayati
translated: And this shows immortality preceded by going.

original: amṛtatvaṃ ca parasmin brahmaṇi upapadyate na kārye /
analyzed: amṛta tvam ca parasmin brahmaṇi upapadyate na kārye
translated: And immortality is possible in the highest Brahman, not in the effect.

original: vināśitvāt kāryasya /
analyzed: vināśi tvāt kāryasya
translated: Because the effect is perishable.

original: 'atha yatrānyatpaśyati tadalpaṃ tanmartyam' chā / / /
analyzed: atha yatra anyat paśyati tat alpam tat martyam chā
translated: 'But where one sees something else, that is little and that is mortal' (Chānd. 8.11.1).

original: iti pravacanāt /
analyzed: iti pravacanāt
translated: Thus it is declared.

original: paraviṣaya eva ca eṣā gatiḥ kaṭhavallīṣu paṭhyate /
analyzed: para viṣaye eva ca eṣā gatiḥ kaṭhavallīṣu paṭhyate
translated: And this going is recited in the Kena Valli with reference to the highest (Self).

original: na hi tatra vidyāntaraprakramaḥ asti 'anyatra dharmādanyatrādharmāt' ka / /
analyzed: na hi tatra vidyā antara prakramaḥ asti anyatra dharmāt anyatra adharmāt kaḥ
translated: For there is no other subject-matter of enquiry, since the text itself declares that Brahman is to be enquired after, 'Brahman is to be known' (Tai. 2.1).

original: iti parasya eva brahmaṇaḥ prakrāntatvāt // //
analyzed: iti parasya eva brahmaṇaḥ prakrānta tvāt
translated: And the subject-matter of the enquiry is not the effect, because the text itself declares that Brahman is to be known as different from the effect.

original: na ca kārye pratipattyabhisaṃdhiḥ / / / /
analyzed: na ca kārye pratipatti abhisaṃdhiḥ
translated: And the purport of the text is not the attainment of the effect.

original: api ca 'prajāpateḥ sabhāṃ veśma prapadye' chā / / /🔽iti na ayaṃ kāryaviṣayaḥ pratipatti abhisaṃdhiḥ 'nāmarūpayornirvahitā te yadantarā tadbrahma' chā / / /
analyzed: api ca prajāpateḥ sabhām veśma prapadye chā  iti na ayam kārya viṣayaḥ pratipatti abhisaṃdhiḥ nāma rūpayoḥ nirvahitā te yat antarā tat brahma chā
translated: Moreover, the purport of the text, 'I enter the house, the assembly of Prajapati' (Ch. 8.1.1), is not the attainment of the effect.

original: iti kāryavilakṣaṇasya parasya eva brahmaṇaḥ prakṛtatvāt /🔽'yaśo 'haṃ bhavāmi brāhmaṇānām' chā / / /
analyzed: iti kārya vilakṣaṇasya parasya eva brahmaṇaḥ prakṛta tvāt  yaśaḥ ham bhavāmi brāhmaṇānām chā
translated: Because Brahman, which is different from the effect, is the subject-matter of the enquiry, as declared in the text, 'That which is manifested as name and form, that is Thine; what is other than that is Brahman' (Ch. 8.11.1).

original: iti ca sarvātmatvena upakramaṇāt /
analyzed: iti ca sarva ātma tvena upakramaṇāt
translated: And because Brahman is referred to as the Self of all in the text, 'I am the glory of Brahmanas' (Ch. 8.1.1).🔽And because it is well known that the glory of Brahman is called 'name'.

original: 'na tasya pratimā asti /
analyzed: na tasya pratimā asti
translated: As it is said, 'He has no image.

original: yasya nāmamahadyaśaḥ' śvetā / /🔽iti ca parasya eva brahmaṇo yaśonāmatva prasiddheḥ /
analyzed: yasya nāma mahat yaśaḥ śvetā  iti ca parasya eva brahmaṇaḥ yaśaḥ nāma tva prasiddheḥ
translated: His name is the great glory' (Svet. 6.11).

original: 'sā ceyaṃ veśmapratipattirgatipūrvikā hārdavidyāyāmuditā tadaparājitā pūrbrahmaṇaḥ prabhuvimitaṃ hiraṇmayam' chā / / / iti atra /
analyzed: sā ca iyam veśma pratipattiḥ gati pūrvikā hārdavidyāyām uditā tad aparājitā pūḥ brahmaṇaḥ prabhu vimitam hiraṇmayam chā iti atra
translated: And this attainment of the house, preceded by the attainment of the path, is mentioned in the knowledge of the heart in the text, 'That imperishable, the golden one, measured by the powerful Brahman' (Ch. 8.1.2).

original: paderapi ca gatyarthatvāt mārga apekṣā avasīyate /
analyzed: padeḥ api ca gati artha tvāt mārga apekṣā avasīyate
translated: And since the word 'pada' also means 'going', the need for a path is understood.

original: tasmāt parabrahmaviṣayā gatiśrutaya iti pakṣāntaram /
analyzed: tasmāt para brahma viṣayāḥ gati śrutayaḥ iti pakṣa antaram
translated: Therefore, the other view is that the statements about going refer to the supreme Brahman.

original: tau etau dvau pakṣau ācāryeṇa sūtritau gati upapattyādibhiḥ
analyzed: tau etau dvau pakṣau ācāryeṇa sūtritau gati upapatti ādibhiḥ
translated: Those two views have been presented by the teacher with 'going is possible' etc.

original: eko mukhyatvādibhiḥ aparaḥ /
analyzed: ekaḥ mukhya tva ādibhiḥ aparaḥ
translated: One with 'being primary' etc.

original: tatra gati upapattyādayaḥ prabhavanti mukhyatvādīna ābhāsayituṃ na tu mukhyatvādayo gati upapattyādīn ityādya eva siddhānto vyākhyāto dvitīyaḥ
analyzed: tatra gati upapatti ādayaḥ prabhavanti mukhya tva ādīn ābhāsayitum na tu mukhya tva ādayaḥ gati upapatti ādīn iti ādyaḥ eva siddhāntaḥ vyākhyātaḥ dvitīyaḥ
translated: Among them, 'going is possible' etc. are capable of illuminating 'being primary' etc., but not vice versa. Thus the first view alone has been explained as the final view, the second

original: pūrvapakṣaḥ /
analyzed: pūrvapakṣaḥ
translated: is the prima facie view.

original: na hi asati api saṃbhave mukhyasya eva arthasya grahaṇam iti kaścit ājñāpayitā vidyate /
analyzed: na hi asati api saṃbhave mukhyasya eva arthasya grahaṇam iti kaścid ājñāpayitā vidyate
translated: For there is no one to command that the primary meaning should be accepted even when it is not possible.

original: paravidyāprakaraṇe api ca tat stutyarthaṃ vidyāntara āśrayagati anukīrtanam upapadyate 'viṣvaṅṅanyā utkramaṇe bhavanti' chā / / / itivat
analyzed: para vidyā prakaraṇe api ca tat stuti artham vidyā antare āśraya gati anukīrtanam upapadyate viṣvaṅ anyāḥ utkramaṇe bhavanti chā itivat
translated: And in the context of the supreme knowledge, the glorification of other paths as the basis of knowledge is appropriate for the purpose of praising that knowledge, like in 'Others go in all directions at the time of liberation' (ChU 8.15.1).

original: 'prajāpateḥ sabhāṃ veśma prapadye' chā / / /
analyzed: prajāpateḥ sabhām veśma prapadye chā
translated: 'I enter the assembly hall and abode of Prajapati' (ChU 5.10.5).

original: iti tu pūrvavākyavicchedena kārye api pratipatti abhisaṃdhiḥ na virudhyate /
analyzed: iti tu pūrva vākya vicchedena kārye api pratipatti abhisaṃdhiḥ na virudhyate
translated: But the intention to attain the goal is not contradicted even in the case of an action, if there is a break in the preceding sentence.

original: saguṇe api ca brahmaṇi sarvātmatva saṃkīrtanaṃ sarvakarmā sarvakāma ityādivat avakalpate /
analyzed: saguṇe api ca brahmaṇi sarva ātma tva saṃkīrtanam sarva karmā sarva kāma ityādi vat avakalpate
translated: And the glorification of Brahman as the Self of all is possible even if Brahman has qualities, just as the glorification of Brahman as the doer of all actions and the enjoyer of all fruits is possible.

original: tasmāt aparaviṣayā eva gatiśrutayaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt apara viṣayāḥ eva gati śrutayaḥ
translated: Therefore, the statements about going have only the other world as their domain.

original: kecit punaḥ pūrvāṇi pūrvapakṣasūtrāṇi bhavanti uttarāṇi siddhāntasūtrāṇi iti etāṃ
analyzed: kecid punar pūrvāṇi pūrvapakṣa sūtrāṇi bhavanti uttarāṇi siddhānta sūtrāṇi iti etām
translated: But some, following the arrangement that the earlier sūtras are the pūrvapakṣa and the later ones are the siddhānta,

original: vyavasthānam anurudhyamānāḥ paraviṣayā eva gatiśrutīḥ pratiṣṭhāpayanti tat anupapannaṃ
analyzed: vyavasthānam anurudhyamānāḥ para viṣayāḥ eva gati śrutīḥ pratiṣṭhāpayanti tat anupapannam
translated: establish that the statements about going have only the other world as their domain. That is not correct.

original: gantavyatva anupapatteḥ brahmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: gantavyatva anupapatteḥ brahmaṇaḥ
translated: Because it is not possible for Brahman to be the destination.

original: yat sarvagataṃ sarvāntaraṃ sarvātmakaṃ ca paraṃ brahma 'ākāśavatsarvagataśca nityaḥ' 'yatsākṣādaparokṣādbrahma' bṛ / / /
analyzed: yat sarva gatam sarva antaram sarva ātmakam ca param brahma ākāśa vat sarva gataḥ ca nityaḥ yat sākṣāt aparokṣāt brahma
translated: That supreme Brahman, which is declared by such scriptural passages as It is omnipresent like space, eternal (Tai. 2.1), That which is directly perceived, the other Brahman (Brh. 4.3.7),

original: 'ya ātmā sarvāntaraḥ' bṛ / / /
analyzed: yaḥ ātmā sarva antaraḥ bṛ
translated: That Self which is within all (Brh. 4.4.22),

original: 'ātmaivedaṃ sarvam' chā / / /
analyzed: ātmā eva idam sarvam chā
translated: The Self is all this (Ch. 7.25.2),

original: 'brahmaivedaṃ viśvamidaṃ variṣṭham' mu / / /🔽ityādi śrutinirdhārita viśeṣaṃ tasya gantavyatā na kadācit api upapadyate /
analyzed: brahma eva idam viśvam idam variṣṭham mu  ityādi śruti nirdhārita viśeṣam tasya gantavya tā na kadācid api upapadyate
translated: Brahman is this universe, the best of all (Mu. 1.1.9),🔽has a nature determined by such scriptural passages, it is never possible for it to be the destination.

original: na hi gatameva gamyate /
analyzed: na hi gatam eva gamyate
translated: For what has been reached is not reached again.

original: anyo hi anyat gacchati iti prasiddhaṃ loke /
analyzed: anyaḥ hi anyat gacchati iti prasiddham loke
translated: For it is well known in the world that one goes to another place.

original: nanu loke gatasya api gantavyatā deśāntaraviśiṣṭā dṛṣṭā /
analyzed: nanu loke gatasya api gantavya tā deśa antara viśiṣṭā dṛṣṭā
translated: But in the world, even of what has gone, the state of being to be gone to is seen to be qualified by another place.

original: yathā pṛthivīstha eva pṛthivīṃ deśāntaradvāreṇa gacchati iti /
analyzed: yathā pṛthivī sthaḥ eva pṛthivīm deśa antara dvāreṇa gacchati iti
translated: Just as one standing on the earth goes to the earth by the door of another place.

original: tathā ananyatve api sarvaśakti upetatvāt kathañcit gantavyatā syāt iti / na /
analyzed: tathā ananyatve api sarvaśakti upetatvāt kathañcit gantavyatā syāt iti na
translated: So, even if there is no difference, because of being endowed with all power, there might somehow be the state of being to be gone to. No.

original: pratiṣiddhasarvaviśeṣatvāt brahmaṇaḥ /🔽'niṣkalaṃ niṣkriyaṃ śāntaṃ niravadyaṃ nirañjanam'śvetā / /
analyzed: pratiṣiddha sarva viśeṣa tvāt brahmaṇaḥ  niṣkalam niṣkriyam śāntam niravadyam nirañjanam śvetā
translated: Because Brahman has all distinctions refuted.🔽'Partless, actionless, peaceful, faultless, unstained' (Svet Up. 4.19).

original: 'asthūlamanaṇvahrasvamadīrgham'bṛ / / /
analyzed: a sthūlam an aṇu a hrasvam a dīrgham bṛ
translated: 'Not gross, not atomic, not short, not long' (Brh. Up. 2.3.1).

original: 'sabāhyābhyantaro hyajaḥ'mu / / /
analyzed: sa bāhya abhyantaraḥ hi a jaḥ mu
translated: 'The unborn, indeed, is without inside or outside' (Mu. Up. 2.1.4).

original: 'sa vā eṣa mahānaja ātmājaro 'maro 'mṛto 'bhayo brahma'bṛ / / /
analyzed: sa vai eṣa mahān ajaḥ ātmā ajaraḥ maraḥ mṛtaḥ bhayaḥ brahma bṛ
translated: 'That is the great unborn Self, undecaying, undying, immortal, fearless, Brahman' (Brh. Up. 4.4.25).

original: 'sa eṣa neti netyātmā'bṛ / / /
analyzed: saḥ eṣa na iti na iti ātmā ābṛ
translated: 'That Self is to be described by No, No' (Brh. Up. 3.9.26).

original: ityādi śruti smṛti nyāyebhyo na deśakālādi viśeṣayogaḥ paramātmani kalpayituṃ śakyate /
analyzed: ityādi śruti smṛti nyāyebhyaḥ na deśa kāla ādi viśeṣa yogaḥ paramātmani kalpayitum śakyate
translated: Thus, on account of the scriptures, smrti texts, and reasonings, it is not possible to imagine the highest Self to be connected with distinctions of place, time, etc.,

original: yena bhūpradeśa vayovasthā nyāyena asya gantavyatā syāt /
analyzed: yena bhū pradeśa vayaḥ vasthā nyāyena asya gantavya tā syāt
translated: by which there might be for it the state of being to be gone to, according to the analogy of the part of the earth or the state of being.

original: bhūvayasoḥ tu pradeśa avasthādi viśeṣayogāt upapadyate deśa kāla viśiṣṭā gantavyatā /
analyzed: bhū vayasoḥ tu pradeśa avasthā ādi viśeṣa yogāt upapadyate deśa kāla viśiṣṭā gantavya tā
translated: But for earth and being, the state of being to be gone to, qualified by place and time, is possible, because of their connection with distinctions such as part and state.

original: jagat utpatti sthiti pralayahetutva śruteḥ anekaśaktitvaṃ brahmaṇa iti cet / na /
analyzed: jagat utpatti sthiti pralaya hetutva śruteḥ aneka śaktitvam brahmaṇaḥ iti ced na
translated: If it be said that Brahman has many powers because of the Vedic texts declaring Him to be the cause of the creation, sustentation, and re-absorption of the world, (we say) no.

original: viśeṣanirākaraṇaśrutīnām ananyārthatvāt /
analyzed: viśeṣa nirākaraṇa śrutīnām ananya artha tvāt
translated: Because the texts denying distinctions have no other meaning.

original: utpattyādiśrutīnām api samānam ananyārthatvam iti cet / na /
analyzed: utpatti ādi śrutīnām api samānam ananya artha tvam iti ced na
translated: If it be said that the texts about creation, etc., have no other meaning, (we say) no.

original: tāsām ekatvapratipādanaparatvāt /
analyzed: tāsām eka tva pratipādana para tvāt
translated: Because they are occupied with teaching unity.

original: mṛdādi dṛṣṭāntaiḥ hi sato brahmaṇa ekasya satyatvaṃ vikārasya ca āvṛtatvaṃ pratipādayat śāstraṃ na utpattyādiparaṃ bhavitum arhati /
analyzed: mṛd ādi dṛṣṭāntaiḥ hi sataḥ brahmaṇaḥ ekasya satya tvam vikārasya ca āvṛta tvam pratipādayat śāstram na utpatti ādi param bhavitum arhati
translated: For the scriptures, teaching by the examples of clay, etc., that Brahman, which is real, is one only, and that modification is unreal, cannot be occupied with teaching creation, etc.

original: kasmāt punaḥ utpattyādi śrutīnāṃ viśeṣatvaṃ na punaḥ itara śeṣatvam itarāsām iti /
analyzed: kasmāt punar utpatti ādi śrutīnām viśeṣa tvam na punar itara śeṣa tvam itarāsām iti
translated: Why then are the texts about creation, etc., particular, and not the others?

original: ucyate viśeṣanirākaraṇaśrutīnāṃ nirākāṅkṣārthatvāt /
analyzed: ucyate viśeṣa nirākaraṇa śrutīnām nirākāṅkṣa artha tvāt
translated: It is said that the texts denying distinctions have no other meaning.

original: na hi ātmana ekatva nityatva śuddhatvādi avagatau satyāṃ bhūyaḥ kācit ākāṅkṣā upajāyate puruṣārthasamāptibuddhi upapatteḥ /
analyzed: na hi ātmanaḥ ekatva nitya tva śuddha tva ādi avagatau satyām bhūyas kācid ākāṅkṣā upajāyate puruṣa artha samāpti buddhi upapatteḥ
translated: For when the unity, eternity, and purity of the Self, etc., are known, no further desire arises, because the idea of the completion of the human goal is proper.

original: 'tatra ko mohaḥ kaḥ śoka ekatvamanupaśyataḥ' īśā /
analyzed: tatra kaḥ mohaḥ kaḥ śokaḥ eka tvam anupaśyataḥ īśā
translated: What delusion, what grief can there be to one who sees unity? (Isa. 7)

original: 'abhayaṃ vai janaka prāpto 'si' bṛ / / /
analyzed: abhayam vai janaka prāptaḥ si bṛ
translated: O Janaka, you have indeed attained fearlessness. (Br. 3.4.1)

original: 'vidvānna bibheti kutaścana /🔽etaṃ ha vāva na tapati kimahaṃ sādhu nākaravaṃ kimahaṃ pāpamakaravam' taitti / / /
analyzed: vidvān na bibheti kutaścana  etam ha vāva na tapati kim aham sādhu na akaravam kim aham pāpam akaravam taitti
translated: 'The learned one is not afraid of anything' (Taitt. Up. 2.9.1).🔽'He does not burn with grief, thinking, What good have I not done? What evil have I done?' (Taitt. Up. 2.9.1).🔽🔽

original: ityādiśrutibhyaḥ /
analyzed: ityādi śrutibhyaḥ
translated: 1.4.10) and so on.

original: tathā eva ca viduṣāṃ tuṣṭi anubhavādi darśanāt /
analyzed: tathā eva ca viduṣām tuṣṭi anubhava ādi darśanāt
translated: And in the same way, because of the perception of the satisfaction, experience, etc. of the wise.

original: vikāra anṛta abhisaṃdhi apavādāt ca 'mṛtyoḥ sa mṛtyumāpnoti ya iha nāneva paśyati' iti /
analyzed: vikāra anṛta abhisaṃdhi apavādāt ca mṛtyoḥ sa mṛtyum āpnoti yaḥ iha nānā iva paśyati iti
translated: And because of the denial of the assumption of modification and untruth, 'He who sees diversity here attains death from death' (Ka. 2.1.10).

original: ato na viśeṣanirākaraṇa śrutīnām anyaśeṣatvam avagantuṃ śakyate /
analyzed: atas na viśeṣa nirākaraṇa śrutīnām anya śeṣa tvam avagantum śakyate
translated: Therefore, it cannot be understood that the denials of particular things are supplementary to something else.

original: na evam utpattyādi śrutīnāṃ nirākāṅkṣārtha pratipādanasāmarthyam asti /
analyzed: na evam utpatti ādi śrutīnām nirākāṅkṣa artha pratipādana sāmarthyam asti
translated: The statements about origination, etc. do not have the ability to convey a complete meaning.

original: pratyakṣaṃ tu tāsām anyārthatvaṃ samanugamyate /
analyzed: pratyakṣam tu tāsām anya artha tvam samanugamyate
translated: But their having a different meaning is directly perceived.

original: tathā hi 'tatraitacchruṅgamutpatitaṃ somya vijānīhi nedamamūlaṃ bhaviṣyati' chā / / /
analyzed: tathā hi tatra etat śruṅgam utpatitam somya vijānīhi na idam amūlam bhaviṣyati chā
translated: Thus, having introduced, 'O Somya, know that this peak has arisen. It cannot be without a root' (Ch. 6.8.3),

original: iti upanyasya udarke sata eva ekasya jagat mūlasya vijñeyatvaṃ darśayati /🔽'yato vā imāni bhūtāni jāyante /
analyzed: iti upanyasya udarke sataḥ eva ekasya jagat mūlasya vijñeya tvam darśayati  yatas vai imāni bhūtāni jāyante
translated: in the Upaniṣad it shows that only the one real root of the world is to be known.🔽'From which these beings are born,

original: yena jātāni jīvanti yatprayantyabhisaṃviśanti /
analyzed: yena jātāni jīvanti yat prayanti abhisaṃviśanti
translated: by which, when born, they live, into which they enter at the time of dissolution.'

original: tadvijijñāsasva /
analyzed: tat vijijñāsasva
translated: Therefore, seek to know that.

original: tadbrahmeti' tai / / / iti ca /
analyzed: tat brahma iti tai iti ca
translated: That is Brahman.

original: evam utpattyādiśrutīnām aikātmya avagamaparatvāt na anekaśaktiyogo brahmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: evam utpatti ādi śrutīnām aikātmya avagama para tvāt na aneka śakti yogaḥ brahmaṇaḥ
translated: Thus, because the scriptures on origination, etc., are meant to convey the knowledge of non-duality, Brahman does not possess multiple powers.

original: ataḥ ca gantavyatva anupapattiḥ /🔽'na tasya prāṇā utkramanti brahmaiva sanbrahmāpyeti' bṛ / / /
analyzed: atas ca gantavyatva anupapattiḥ  na tasya prāṇāḥ utkramanti brahma eva san brahma apyeti bṛ
translated: And therefore, the doctrine of going to Brahman is untenable.

original: iti ca parasmin brahmaṇi gatiṃ nivārayati /
analyzed: iti ca parasmin brahmaṇi gatim nivārayati
translated: And the text, His vital breaths do not depart; being Brahman, he goes to Brahman, (Br. 4.4.22) prohibits going to the supreme Brahman.

original: tat vyākhyātaṃ 'spaṣṭo hyekeṣām' bra / sū / / / ityatra /
analyzed: tat vyākhyātam spaṣṭaḥ hi ekeṣām iti atra
translated: This has been explained in the Brahmasutra (3.2.13), where it is said, For some, it is indeed clear.

original: gatikalpanāyāṃ ca gantā jīvo gantavyasya brahmaṇaḥ avayavo vikāro vā tataḥ syāt /
analyzed: gati kalpanāyām ca gantā jīvaḥ gantavyasya brahmaṇaḥ avayavaḥ vikāraḥ vā tatas syāt
translated: And in the postulation of going, the individual soul, the goer, would be a part or modification of Brahman, the place to be gone to.

original: atyanta tādātmye gamana anupapatteḥ /
analyzed: atyanta tādātmye gamana anupapatteḥ
translated: Because going is impossible if there is absolute identity.

original: yadi evaṃ tataḥ kiṃ syāt /
analyzed: yadi evam tatas kim syāt
translated: If this is so, then what follows?

original: ucyate /
analyzed: ucyate
translated: It is said:

original: yadi ekadeśaḥ tena ekadeśino nityaprāptatvāt na punaḥ brahmagamanam upapadyate /
analyzed: yadi ekadeśaḥ tena ekadeśinaḥ nitya prāpta tvāt na punar brahmagamanam upapadyate
translated: If it is a part, then because the possessor of the part is always attained, going to Brahman is not tenable.

original: ekadeśitva kalpanā ca brahmaṇi anupapannā niravayavatva prasiddheḥ /
analyzed: ekadeśitva kalpanā ca brahmaṇi anupapannā niravayavatva prasiddheḥ
translated: And the postulation of being a part of Brahman is untenable, because Brahman is well-known to be partless.

original: vikārapakṣe api etat atulyaṃ vikāreṇa api vikāriṇo nityaprāptatvāt /
analyzed: vikāra pakṣe api etat atulyam vikāreṇa api vikāriṇaḥ nitya prāpta tvāt
translated: Even in the case of being a modification, this is not tenable, because the modified is always attained even by the modification.

original: na hi ghaṭo mṛdātmatāṃ parityajya avatiṣṭhate parityāge vā abhāvaprāpteḥ /
analyzed: na hi ghaṭaḥ mṛd ātma tām parityajya avatiṣṭhate parityāge vā abhāva prāpteḥ
translated: For a pot does not remain after abandoning its nature of being clay; or if it were to abandon it, it would become non-existent.

original: vikāra avayavapakṣayoḥ ca tadvataḥ sthiratvāt brahmaṇaḥ saṃsāragamanam api anavakḷptam /
analyzed: vikāra avayavapakṣayoḥ ca tadvataḥ sthira tvāt brahmaṇaḥ saṃsāragamanam api anavakḷptam
translated: And if the individual soul were a modification or a part of Brahman, then Brahman's going into the cycle of birth and death would also be inexplicable, because of its permanence.

original: atha anya eva jīvo brahmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: atha anyaḥ eva jīvaḥ brahmaṇaḥ
translated: Now, if the individual soul is different from Brahman,

original: saḥ aṇuḥ vyāpī madyama parimāṇo vā bhavitum arhati /
analyzed: saḥ aṇuḥ vyāpī madyama parimāṇaḥ vā bhavitum arhati
translated: then it must be either atomic, all-pervading, or of medium size.

original: vyāpitve gamana anupapattiḥ /
analyzed: vyāpi tve gamana anupapattiḥ
translated: If it is all-pervading, then going is inexplicable.

original: madhyama parimāṇatve ca anityatvaprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: madhyama parimāṇa tve ca anitya tva prasaṅgaḥ
translated: And if it is of medium size, then it would follow that it is impermanent.

original: aṇutve kṛtsnaśarīravedanā anupapattiḥ /
analyzed: aṇu tve kṛtsna śarīra vedanā anupapattiḥ
translated: And if it is atomic, then the experience of the entire body is inexplicable.

original: pratiṣiddhe ca aṇutva madhyama parimāṇatve vistareṇa purastāt /🔽parasmāt ca anyatve jīvasya 'tattvamasi' chā / / /
analyzed: pratiṣiddhe ca aṇu tva madhyama parimāṇa tve vistareṇa purastāt  parasmāt ca anyatve jīvasya tattvam asi chā
translated: And atomicity and medium size have been refuted in detail earlier.

original: ityādi śāstra bādha prasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: ityādi śāstra bādha prasaṅgaḥ
translated: And if the individual soul were different from the highest Self, then it would follow that the scriptures such as That thou art (Ch. 6.8.7) are contradicted.

original: vikāra avayavapakṣayoḥ api samānaḥ ayaṃ doṣaḥ /
analyzed: vikāra avayava pakṣayoḥ api samānaḥ ayam doṣaḥ
translated: And this fault is the same in the case of the soul being a modification or a part [of Brahman].

original: vikāra avayavayoḥ tadvatoḥ ananyatvāt adoṣa iti cet / na /
analyzed: vikāra avayavayoḥ tadvatoḥ ananyatvāt adoṣa iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that there is no fault because the modification or the part is not different from that which possesses it, that is not so.

original: mukhya ekatva anupapatteḥ /
analyzed: mukhya ekatva anupapatteḥ
translated: Because the primary oneness is inexplicable.

original: sarveṣu eteṣu pakṣeṣu anirmokṣaprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: sarveṣu eteṣu pakṣeṣu anirmokṣa prasaṅgaḥ
translated: In all these views, the undesirable consequence follows that there is no liberation.

original: saṃsāri ātmatva anivṛtteḥ /
analyzed: saṃsāri ātmatva anivṛtteḥ
translated: Because the state of being the transmigrating self does not cease.

original: nivṛttau vā svarūpanāśaprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: nivṛttau vā svarūpa nāśa prasaṅgaḥ
translated: Or, if it were to cease, there would be the undesirable consequence of the destruction of its own nature.

original: brahmātmatva anabhyupagamāt ca /
analyzed: brahmātmatva anabhyupagamāt ca
translated: And because the identity with Brahman is not accepted.

original: yat tu kaiścit jalpyate nityāni naimittikāni karmāṇi anuṣṭhīyante pratyavāya anutpattaye🔽kāmyāni pratiṣiddhāni ca parihriyante svarganarakān avāptaye sāṃpratadeha upabhogyāni🔽ca karmāṇi upabhogena eva kṣapyanta ityato vartamānadehapātāt ūrdhvaṃ dehāntara pratisaṃdhāna
analyzed: yat tu kaiścid jalpyate nityāni naimittikāni karmāṇi anuṣṭhīyante pratyavāya anutpattaye  kāmyāni pratiṣiddhāni ca parihriyante svarga narakān avāptaye sāṃprata deha upabhogyāni  ca karmāṇi upabhogena eva kṣapyante iti atas vartamāna dehapātāt ūrdhvam deha antara pratisaṃdhāna
translated: But what is argued by some, that obligatory and occasional rites are performed in order to prevent the arising of obstacles,

original: kāraṇa abhāvāt svarūpa avasthānalakṣaṇaṃ kaivalyaṃ vinā api brahmātmataya evaṃvṛttasya setsyati iti /
analyzed: kāraṇa abhāvāt svarūpa avasthāna lakṣaṇam kaivalyam vinā api brahma ātmataye evaṃvṛttasya setsyati iti
translated: and that desirable and prohibited acts are avoided in order to attain heaven and hell, and that acts to be experienced in this life are destroyed by mere experience, therefore, after the fall of the present body, due to the absence of a cause for the conjunction with another body, the liberation characterized by the abiding in one's own nature will be accomplished even without Brahman-hood for one who conducts oneself in this way.

original: tat asat /
analyzed: tat asat
translated: That is not so.

original: pramāṇa abhāvāt /
analyzed: pramāṇa abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no valid means of knowledge.

original: na hi etat śāstreṇa kenacit pratipāditaṃ mokṣārthi itthaṃ samācaret iti /
analyzed: na hi etat śāstreṇa kenacid pratipāditam mokṣa arthi ittham samācaret iti
translated: For this has not been taught by any scripture that one who seeks liberation should conduct oneself in this way.

original: svamanīṣayā tu etat tarkitaṃ yasmāt karmanimittaḥ saṃsāraḥ tasmāt nimitta abhāvāt na bhaviṣyati iti /
analyzed: sva manīṣayā tu etat tarkitam yasmāt karma nimittaḥ saṃsāraḥ tasmāt nimitta abhāvāt na bhaviṣyati iti
translated: But this has been reasoned out by one's own intellect: Since worldly existence is caused by action, therefore it will not occur due to the absence of a cause.

original: na ca etat tarkayitum api śakyate nimitta abhāvasya durjñānatvāt /🔽bahūni hi karmāṇi jātyantarasaṃcitāni iṣṭa aniṣṭavipākāni ekaikasya jantoḥ saṃbhāvyante /
analyzed: na ca etat tarkayitum api śakyate nimitta abhāvasya durjñāna tvāt  bahūni hi karmāṇi jāti antara saṃcitāni iṣṭa aniṣṭa vipākāni ekaikasya jantoḥ saṃbhāvyante
translated: And this cannot even be conjectured, because the absence of a cause is difficult to know.🔽For many actions accumulated in other births, with desirable and undesirable results, are possible for each individual.

original: teṣāṃ viruddha phalānāṃ yugapat upabhoga asaṃbhavāt kānicit labdha avasarāṇi idaṃ🔽janma nirmimate kānicit tu deśakālanimittapratīkṣāṇi asata iti ataḥ teṣām avaśiṣṭānāṃ
analyzed: teṣām viruddha phalānām yugapad upabhoga asaṃbhavāt kānicid labdha avasarāṇi idaṃ  janma nirmimate kānicid tu deśa kāla nimitta pratīkṣāṇi asataḥ iti atas teṣām avaśiṣṭānām
translated: Since those with conflicting results cannot be experienced simultaneously, some of them obtain an opportunity and create this birth.🔽But some await place, time, and cause, and are not. Therefore, since it is not possible to destroy the remaining ones

original: sāṃpratena upabhogena kṣapaṇāsaṃbhavāt na yathāvarṇitacaritasya api vartamānadehapāte
analyzed: sāṃpratena upabhogena kṣapaṇa asaṃbhavāt na yathā varṇita caritasya api vartamāna dehapāte
translated: by experiencing them in the present, even for one who has acted as described, the absence of a cause for another body after the fall of the present body

original: dehāntaranimitta abhāvaḥ śakyate niścetum /
analyzed: deha antara nimitta abhāvaḥ śakyate niścetum
translated: cannot be ascertained.

original: karmaśeṣasadbāvasiddhaḥ ca 'tadya iha ramaṇīyacaraṇāstataḥ śeṣeṇa' ityādi śruti smṛtibhyaḥ /
analyzed: karma śeṣa sadbāva siddhaḥ ca tat ye iha ramaṇīya caraṇāḥ tatas śeṣeṇa ityādi śruti smṛtibhyaḥ
translated: And the existence of the remainder of karma is established by the scriptures and smrti texts such as Those who have enjoyed pleasures here, by the remainder...

original: syāt etat /
analyzed: syāt etat
translated: This may be said:

original: nitya naimittikāni teṣāṃ kṣepakāṇi bhaviṣyanti iti /
analyzed: nitya naimittikāni teṣām kṣepakāṇi bhaviṣyanti iti
translated: The obligatory and occasional rites will be the destroyers of those.

original: tat na /
analyzed: tat na
translated: That is not so.

original: virodha abhāvāt /
analyzed: virodha abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no contradiction.

original: sati hi virodhe kṣepyakṣepakabhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: sati hi virodhe kṣepya kṣepaka bhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: For the relation of what is to be destroyed and what destroys it exists only when there is contradiction.

original: na ca janmāntara saṃcitānāṃ sukṛtānāṃ nitya naimittikaiḥ asti virodhaḥ /
analyzed: na ca janmāntara saṃcitānām sukṛtānām nitya naimittikaiḥ asti virodhaḥ
translated: And there is no contradiction between the obligatory and occasional rites and the good deeds accumulated in other lives.

original: śuddharūpatva aviśeṣāt /
analyzed: śuddha rūpa tva aviśeṣāt
translated: Because of the absence of any distinction in their pure form.

original: duritānāṃ tu aśuddhirūpatvāt sati virodhe bhavatu kṣapaṇaṃ na tu tāvatā dehāntara nimitta abhāvasiddhiḥ /
analyzed: duritānām tu aśuddhi rūpa tvāt sati virodhe bhavatu kṣapaṇam na tu tāvatā deha antara nimitta abhāva siddhiḥ
translated: But if there is a contradiction, let there be the destruction of the bad deeds, which have an impure form. But that does not prove the absence of a cause for another body.

original: sukṛtanimittatva upapatteḥ /
analyzed: sukṛta nimitta tve upapatteḥ
translated: Because it is possible for another result to arise, even though it is not produced immediately.

original: duścaritasya api aśeṣakṣapaṇa anavagamāt /
analyzed: duścaritasya api aśeṣakṣapaṇa anavagamāt
translated: And because it is not known that all bad conduct is completely destroyed.

original: na ca nitya naimittikānuṣṭhānāt pratyavāya anutpattimātraṃ na punaḥ phalāntara utpattiḥ iti pramāṇam asti phalāntarasya api anuniṣpādinaḥ saṃbhavāt
analyzed: na ca nitya naimittika anuṣṭhānāt pratyavāya anutpatti mātram na punar phala antara utpattiḥ iti pramāṇam asti phala antarasya api anuniṣpādinaḥ saṃbhavāt
translated: And there is no proof that by performing the obligatory and occasional rites, only the non-arising of the undesirable consequence occurs, and not the arising of another result. Because it is possible for another result to arise, even though it is not produced immediately.

original: smarati hi āpastambaḥ 'tadyathāmre phalārte nimitte chāyāgandhāvanūtpadyete evaṃ dharmaṃ caryamāṇārthā anūtpadyante' iti /
analyzed: smarati hi āpastambaḥ tat yathā āmre phala ārte nimitte chāyā gandhau anūtpadyete evam dharmam caryamāṇa arthāḥ anūtpadyante iti
translated: For Apastamba remembers: 'Just as when a mango tree is planted for the sake of its fruit, the shade and fragrance are produced as a by-product, in the same way, when dharma is practiced, wealth is produced as a by-product.'

original: na ca asati samyak darśane sarvātmanā kāmyapratiṣiddhavarjanaṃ janmaprāyaṇāntarālaṃ kenacit pratijñātuṃ śakyam /
analyzed: na ca asati samyak darśane sarva ātmanā kāmya pratiṣiddha varjanam janma prāyaṇa antarālam kenacid pratijñātum śakyam
translated: And without right knowledge, no one can undertake the vow to avoid all that is desired and prohibited between birth and death.

original: sunipuṇānam api sūkṣma aparādhadarśanāt /
analyzed: api sūkṣma aparādha darśanāt
translated: Because even the very clever ones are seen to commit subtle offenses.

original: saṃśayitavyaṃ tu bhavati tathā api nimitta abhāvasya durjñānatvameva /
analyzed: saṃśayitavyam tu bhavati tathā api nimitta abhāvasya durjñāna tvam eva
translated: But there is doubt, because the absence of a cause is difficult to know.

original: na ca anabhyupagamyamāne jñānagamye brahmātmatve kartṛtva bhoktṛtva svabhāvasya ātmanaḥ kaivalyam ākāṅkṣituṃ śakyam /
analyzed: na ca an abhyupagamyamāne jñāna gamye brahma ātmatve kartṛ tva bhoktṛ tva svabhāvasya ātmanaḥ kaivalyam ākāṅkṣitum śakyam
translated: And if the Brahman-Self, which is known by knowledge, is not accepted, it is not possible to desire liberation for the Self, which has the nature of an agent and an enjoyer.

original: agni auṣṇyavat svabhāvasya aparihāryatvāt /
analyzed: agni auṣṇyavat svabhāvasya aparihārya tvāt
translated: Because the nature [of the Self] cannot be avoided, just as the heat of fire cannot be avoided.

original: syāt etat /
analyzed: syāt etat
translated: This may be the case.

original: kartṛtva bhoktṛtva kāryam anartho na tat śaktiḥ tena śakti avasthāne 'pi kāryaparihārat upapanno mokṣa iti /
analyzed: kartṛ tva bhoktṛ tva kāryam anarthaḥ na tat śaktiḥ tena śakti avasthāne upapannaḥ mokṣaḥ iti
translated: The effect of being an agent and an enjoyer is a misfortune, not the capacity for that. Therefore, even if the capacity remains, liberation is possible by avoiding the effect.

original: tatca na /
analyzed: tat ca na
translated: But that is not so.

original: śaktisadbhāve kāryaprasavasya durnivāratvāt /
analyzed: śakti sadbhāve kārya prasavasya durnivāra tvāt
translated: Because when the capacity exists, the production of the effect is difficult to stop.🔽Now, this may be the case.

original: atha api syāt na kevalā śaktiḥ kāryam ārabhate anapekṣya anyāni nimittāni /
analyzed: atha api syāt na kevalā śaktiḥ kāryam ārabhate anapekṣya anyāni nimittāni
translated: The capacity alone does not commence the effect, depending on other causes.

original: ata ekākinī sā sthitāpi na aparādhyati iti /
analyzed: atas ekākinī sā sthitā api na aparādhyati iti
translated: Therefore, even though it remains alone, it does not offend.

original: tat ca na /
analyzed: tat ca na
translated: But that is not so.

original: nimittānām api śaktilakṣaṇena saṃbandhena nityasaṃbaddhatvāt /
analyzed: nimittānām api śakti lakṣaṇena saṃbandhena nitya saṃbaddha tvāt
translated: Because even the causes are eternally connected by the relation called capacity.

original: tasmāt kartṛtva bhoktṛtva svabhāve satyām anyasatyāṃ vidyāgamyāyāṃ brahmātmatāyāṃ na kathañcana mokṣaṃ pratyāśā asti /
analyzed: tasmāt kartṛ tva bhoktṛ tva svabhāve satyām anya satyām vidyā gamyāyām brahma ātmatāyām na kathañcana mokṣam asti
translated: Therefore, as long as the nature of being an agent and an enjoyer is real, and the state of being Brahman, which is to be known through knowledge, is not real, there is no hope at all of liberation.

original: śrutiḥ ca 'nānyaḥ panthā vidyate 'yanāya' śvetā / /
analyzed: śrutiḥ ca na anyaḥ panthāḥ vidyate yanāya śvetā
translated: And the śruti declares: There is no other path to go by (Śvetāśvatara Upaniṣad 3.8).

original: iti jñānāt anyaṃ mokṣamārgaṃ vārayati /
analyzed: iti jñānāt anyam mokṣa mārgam vārayati
translated: Thus it denies that there is any path to liberation other than knowledge.

original: parasmāt ananyatve api jīvasya sarvavyavahāra lopaprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: parasmāt ananyatve api jīvasya sarva vyavahāra lopa prasaṅgaḥ
translated: Even if the individual self is not different from the highest Self, it would follow that all worldly activity would cease.

original: pratyakṣādi pramāṇa apravṛtteḥ iti cet / na /
analyzed: pratyakṣādi pramāṇa apravṛtteḥ iti cet na
translated: If it is argued that this is because perception and other means of knowledge would not operate, that is not so.

original: prāk prabodhāt svapnavyavahāravat tat upapatteḥ /🔽śāstraṃ ca 'yatra hi dvaitamiva bhavati taditara itaraṃ paśyati bṛ / / / / / /🔽ityādinā aprabuddhaviṣaye pratyakṣādi vyavahāram uktvā punaḥ prabuddhaviṣaye 'yatra tvasya sarvamātmaivābhūttatkena kaṃ paśyet' bṛ / / / /
analyzed: prāk prabodhāt svapna vyavahāra vat tat upapatteḥ  śāstram ca yatra hi dvaitam iva bhavati tat itaraḥ itaram paśyati  ityādinā aprabuddha viṣaye pratyakṣa ādi vyavahāram uktvā punar prabuddha viṣaye yatra tu asya sarvam ātmā eva abhūt tat kena kam paśyet
translated: Because that is possible, like the worldly activity in a dream before waking up.

original: ityādinā tat abhāvaṃ darśayati /
analyzed: ityādinā tat abhāvam darśayati
translated: And the scripture, having stated the worldly activity of perception etc. in the sphere of the unenlightened with passages such as Where there is duality as it were, then one sees the other (Brhadāranyaka Upaniṣad 4.5.15), again shows its absence in the sphere of the enlightened with passages such as But when the Self alone is all this, how should he see another? (Brhadāranyaka Upaniṣad 4.5.15).

original: tat evaṃ parabrahmavido gantavyādi vijñānasya bādhitatvāt na kathañcana gatiḥ upapādayituṃ śakyā /
analyzed: tat evam para brahma vidaḥ gantavya ādi vijñānasya bādhita tvāt na kathañcana gatiḥ upapādayitum śakyā
translated: Thus, since the knowledge of the place to be gone to, etc., of one who knows the supreme Brahman is contradicted, going cannot be established in any way.

original: kiṃviṣayāḥ punaḥ gatiśrutaya iti /
analyzed: kiṃviṣayāḥ punar gati śrutayaḥ iti
translated: But what is the content of the statements about going?

original: ucyate saguṇavidyāviṣayā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: ucyate sa guṇa vidyā viṣayāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: It is said that they will be about knowledge with qualities.

original: tathā hi kvacit pañcāgnividyāṃ prakṛtya gatiḥ ucyate yathā 'prāṇo brahma kaṃ brahma khaṃ brahma' chā / / /🔽iti 'atha yadidamasminbrahmapure daharaṃ puṇḍarīkaṃ veśma' chā / / /
analyzed: tathā hi kvacid pañcāgni vidyām prakṛtya gatiḥ ucyate yathā prāṇaḥ brahma kam brahma kham brahma chā  iti atha yat idam asmin brahma pure daharam puṇḍarīkam veśma chā
translated: For in some places, beginning with the knowledge of the five fires, going is stated, as in Prana is Brahman, Kam is Brahman, Kham is Brahman (Ch. Up. 5.1.1).

original: iti ca tatra api vāmanītvādibhiḥ satyakāmādibhiḥ ca guṇaiḥ saguṇasya eva upāsyatvāt saṃbhavati gatiḥ /
analyzed: iti ca tatra api vāmanī tva ādibhiḥ satyakāma ādibhiḥ ca guṇaiḥ saguṇasya eva upāsya tvāt saṃbhavati gatiḥ
translated: And in Then this small lotus-house in this city of Brahman (Ch. Up. 8.1.1), even there, since only the Brahman with qualities is to be meditated upon due to qualities like dwarf-ness and having true desires, going is possible.

original: na kvacit parabrahmaviṣayā gatiḥ śrāvyate yathā gatipratiṣedhaḥ śrāvitaḥ 'na tasya prāṇā utkrāmanti' bṛ / / / iti /
analyzed: na kvacid para brahma viṣayā gatiḥ śrāvyate yathā gati pratiṣedhaḥ śrāvitaḥ na tasya prāṇāḥ utkrāmanti iti
translated: Nowhere is going stated to be about the supreme Brahman, as the prohibition of going is stated: His vital breaths do not depart (Bhagavad Gita 8.10).

original: 'brahmavidāpnoti param'tai / / /
analyzed: brahma vidā āpnoti
translated: But in statements like One who knows Brahman attains the supreme (Tai. Up. 2.1),

original: ityādiṣu tu satyapi āpnoteḥ gatyarthatve varṇitena nyāyena deśāntaraprāpti asaṃbhavāt
analyzed: ityādiṣu tu sati api āpnoteḥ gati artha tve varṇitena nyāyena deśa antara prāpti asaṃbhavāt
translated: even though the word attains has the meaning of going, due to the method described, the attainment of another place is not possible.

original: svarūpapratipattiḥ eva iyam avidyā adhyāropita nāma rūpa pravilaya apekṣayā abhidhīyate
analyzed: svarūpa pratipattiḥ eva iyam avidyā adhyāropita nāma rūpa pravilaya apekṣayā abhidhīyate
translated: This very attainment of one's own nature is described with reference to the dissolution of name-and-form superimposed by ignorance.

original: 'brahmaiva sanbrahmāpyeti' bṛ / / /
analyzed: brahma eva san brahma apyeti bṛ
translated: As in the passage, Having become Brahman, he goes to Brahman (Brh. 4.4.22).

original: ityādivat iti draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: ityādi vat iti draṣṭavyam
translated: It should be seen thus.

original: api ca paraviṣayā gatiḥ vyākhyāyamānā prarocanāya vā syāt anucintanāya vā /🔽tatra prarocanaṃ tāvat
analyzed: api ca paraviṣayā gatiḥ vyākhyāyamānā prarocanāya vā syāt anucintanāya vā  tatra prarocanam tāvat
translated: Moreover, when the attainment of the supreme Brahman is being explained, it may be for the purpose of inspiring enthusiasm or for the purpose of contemplation.

original: brahmavido na gati uktyā kriyate /
analyzed: brahma vidaḥ na gatiḥ uktyā kriyate
translated: Among them, enthusiasm is not produced by the statement of attainment for one who knows Brahman.

original: svasaṃvedyena eva avyavahitena vidyāsamarpitena svāsthyena tat siddheḥ /
analyzed: sva saṃvedyena eva avyavahitena vidyā samarpitena svāsthyena tat siddheḥ
translated: Because that is accomplished by the natural state presented by knowledge itself, which is to be experienced by oneself alone, and is not obstructed.

original: na ca nityasiddhaniḥśreyasanivedanasya asādhyaphalasya vijñānasya gati anucintane kācit apekṣā upapadyate /
analyzed: na ca nitya siddha niḥśreyasa nivedanasya asādhya phalasya vijñānasya gati anucintane kācid apekṣā upapadyate
translated: And no expectation is possible of the contemplation of the attainment of the knowledge of Brahman, whose result is eternally accomplished and whose fruit is not to be accomplished.

original: tasmāt aparabrahmaṇi vartamānā gatiḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt aparabrahmaṇi vartamānā gatiḥ
translated: Therefore, the attainment is of the lower Brahman.

original: tatra para aparabrahmaviveka anavadhāraṇena aparasmin brahmaṇi vartamānā gatiśrutayaḥ parasmin adhyāropyante /
analyzed: tatra para apara brahma viveka anavadhāraṇena aparasmin brahmaṇi vartamānāḥ gati śrutayaḥ parasmin adhyāropyante
translated: There, the statements of attainment, which are about the lower Brahman due to the non-ascertainment of the distinction between the higher and lower Brahman, are superimposed on the higher Brahman.

original: kiṃ dve brahmaṇī param aparaṃ ca iti /
analyzed: kim dve brahmaṇī param aparam ca iti
translated: Are there two Brahmans, the higher and the lower?

original: bāḍhaṃ dve 'etadvai satyakāma paraṃ cāparaṃ brahmayadoṅkāraḥ' pra / /
analyzed: bāḍham dve etat vai satya kāma param ca aparam brahma yat oṅkāraḥ pra
translated: Certainly, because of such passages as, Verily, O Satyakama, the syllable Om is the supreme Brahman and the lower Brahman.

original: ityādi darśanāt /
analyzed: ityādi darśanāt
translated: etc.

original: kiṃ punaḥ paraṃ brahma kim aparam iti /
analyzed: kim punar param brahma kim aparam iti
translated: Now, what is the supreme Brahman, and what is the lower?

original: ucyate /
analyzed: ucyate
translated: It is said:

original: yatra avidyākṛta nāma rūpādi viśeṣapratiṣedhāt asthūlādiśabdaiḥ brahma upadiśyate tat param /
